                      <br/>
                      However, other types of scholarships (Erasmus, Moblilex, Mermoz, etc) are available to help finance your studies and mobility while pursuing the MITRA master's degree.

            <div class="sppb-section reverse centautoheigh" id="section-id-1557906451019">
             <div class="sppb-container-inner">
              <div class="sppb-row sppb-no-gutter">
               <div class="sppb-col-md-6" id="column-wrap-id-1557906451017">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1557906451017">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1557906451022">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block sections-txt animated fadeIn duration2 eds-on-scroll dark">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <h1>
                      MITRA,
                      <br>
                       <span class="smallest-block">
                        “Transnational Migrations”
                       </span>
                      </br>
                     </h1>
                     <p>
                      MITRA is a bilingual and interdisciplinary Master’s programme in the social sciences and humanities, taught in both French and English. It addresses international migration and how it impacts contemporary societies.
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      MITRA offers in-depth training to students aiming to specialise in migration studies and go on to doctoral degrees, public policy analysts working on migration and integration (including experts from international and local organisations), and intercultural mediators running community projects.
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      As a member of one of the University of Lille's
                      <a href="http://www.isite-ulne.fr/index.php/en/graduate-programme-changing-cultures-societies-practices/">
                       International Graduate Programmes
                      </a>
                      , MITRA prepares students for both further research and a professional career. This taught programme allows them to work on both European and non-European case studies, combining theoretical analysis with field surveys.
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      Depending on the students’ major, the
                      <a href="/about-mitra/consortium">
                       consortium
                      </a>
                      jointly awards two or three Master’s degrees on completion.
                      <br/>
                      <span style="font-size: 16pt;">
                       <br/>
                      </span>
                     </p>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>

                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-video">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-video-local-video-wrap">

                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <h2>
                      Entry requirements
                     </h2>
                     <p>
                      Applicants are expected to hold a degree in the social sciences, law, foreign languages, and humanities (180 ECTS). Exceptions can be made for students from other disciplines who already have some professional experience. MITRA is taught in both French and English, requiring B2 proficiency (CEFR). The duration of the programme is twenty-four months. Depending on the students’ major, the consortium jointly awards two or three Master’s degrees on completion.
                     </p>

            <div class="sppb-section reverse centautoheigh" id="section-id-1557906451019">
             <div class="sppb-container-inner">
              <div class="sppb-row sppb-no-gutter">
               <div class="sppb-col-md-6" id="column-wrap-id-1557906451017">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1557906451017">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1557906451022">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block sections-txt animated fadeIn duration2 eds-on-scroll dark">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <h1>
                      Master MITRA,
                      <br>
                       <span class="smallest-block">
                        « Migrations transnationales »
                       </span>
                      </br>
                     </h1>
                     <p>
                      Le Master MITRA est un master bilingue (français et anglais) interdisciplinaire en sciences humaines et sociales, consacré à l'étude des phénomènes migratoires à l’échelle internationale et à leurs impacts sur les sociétés contemporaines.
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      MITRA forme des chercheurs spécialistes des phénomènes migratoires (poursuite d’études en doctorat), des analystes des politiques publiques en matière de migration et d'intégration (experts dans les organisations internationales ou territoriales) et des acteurs de terrain dans le milieu associatif.
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      Partie prenante de
                      <a href="http://www.isite-ulne.fr/index.php/fr/programme-gradue-cultures-societes-pratiques-en-mutation/">
                       l'un des programmes gradués internationaux
                      </a>
                      de l'Université de Lille, MITRA est à la fois un master professionnalisant et un master de formation à la recherche. Il est conçu selon une double logique : alternance des territoires d’étude en Europe et hors d’Europe, et alternance entre apprentissage académique et travail de terrain.
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      En fonction des parcours de formation, le
                      <a href="/apropos-mitra/consortium">
                       consortium
                      </a>
                      décerne aux étudiants un double ou triple diplôme de Master.
                      <br/>
                      <span style="font-size: 16pt;">
                       <br/>
                      </span>
                     </p>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="sppb-col-md-6" id="column-wrap-id-1557906451018">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1557906451018">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1558003954263">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-video">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-video-local-video-wrap">
                     <video class="sppb-addon-video-local-source" controls="" controlslist="nodownload" playsinline="" poster="/images/2019/05/16/poster-video-presentation-mitra.jpg">
                      <source src="/media/videos/2019/05/16/Master MITRA - présentation.mp4" type="video/mp4"/>
                     </video>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>

            <div class="sppb-section sppb-section-content-center" id="section-id-1558021948383">
             <div class="sppb-row-overlay">
             </div>
             <div class="sppb-container-inner">
              <div class="sppb-row sppb-no-gutter sppb-align-center">
               <div class="sppb-col-md-6" id="column-wrap-id-1558021948382">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1558021948382">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1558021948386">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block sections-txt dark animated fadeInRightBig duration2 eds-on-scroll">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <h2>
                      À qui s’adresse le Master ?
                     </h2>
                     <p>
                      Ce master s’adresse aux titulaires d’une Licence (180 ECTS) en sciences humaines et sociales, droit, langues, humanités, et par dérogation aux titulaires d’autres licences ayant une expérience professionnelle. MITRA offre une formation en français et anglais (niveau requis B2 du Cadre européen commun de référence) de 4 semestres. En fonction des spécialités de formation, le consortium décerne aux étudiants un double ou triple diplôme de Master.
                     </p>

             <div class="sppb-row-container">
              <div class="sppb-row sppb-no-gutter">
               <div class="sppb-col-md-12" id="column-wrap-id-1559660945076">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1559660945076">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1559660945077">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block sections-txt">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <h1 style="text-align: center;">
                      About MITRA
                      <br/>
                      <br/>
                     </h1>
                     <p>
                      The Erasmus Mundus MITRA programme was launched in 2012 and was originally called “Intercultural Mediation: Identities, Mobilities, and Conflicts”. In the following years, it focused more specifically on the so-called "migrant crisis" in contemporary European societies.
                      <br/>
                      <br/>
                      Moving beyond this Eurocentric approach, the programme now aims to study both local and international migratory dynamics. As a consequence, MITRA teaching staff have allowed for more focus on migrations to be brought into the project.
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      The MITRA Master programme is an Erasmus Joint Master Degree (EJMD), co-funded by the European Agency (
                      <a href="https://eacea.ec.europa.eu/homepage_fr" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
                       EACEA
                      </a>
                      ), since 2012 (2012-2018) and again since 2019 (2019-2024).
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      The
                      <a href="/about-mitra/consortium">
                       consortium
                      </a>
                      is based on complementary disciplinary approaches and includes various sites of study. The different courses offer a vast range of potential field surveys in the
                      <a href="/en/about-mitra/consortium">
                       host countries
                      </a>
                      located in Southern, Central and Eastern Europe, as well as Brazil and Senegal.
                     </p>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </section>

            <div class="sppb-section centautoheigh reverse" id="section-id-1559649552886">
             <div class="sppb-container-inner">
              <div class="sppb-row sppb-no-gutter">
               <div class="sppb-col-md-6" id="column-wrap-id-1559649552895">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1559649552895">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1559649552896">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block sections-txt3">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <h2>
                      How the consortium operates
                     </h2>
                     <p>
                      MITRA students will be awarded their Master’s Degrees from
                      <strong>
                       the European consortium universities
                      </strong>
                      where they will spend at least one semester. Students also spend at least one semester in
                      <strong>
                       Non-European Universities
                      </strong>
                      which, as
                      <strong>
                       associate members
                      </strong>
                      , will not award any degree. Besides, the University of the Aegean (Lesbos, Greece) is an associate member which offers students the opportunity to conduct field studies in Greece. It also organises a summer school
                      <a href="http://www.govunet.com/news.php" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
                       GoVunet
                      </a>
                      .
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      All universities organise scientific events in which students can participate.
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      <strong>
                       Non-academic associate partners
                      </strong>
                      introduce students to the community and voluntary sector by allowing them to join in their voluntary activities or through work placements: For instance, the IRD is involved in teaching by offering various classes at the UCAD in Dakar. The DIADEM facilitates access to field studies depending on the students’ research topics and allows them to participate in the network’s scientific events. The CESPRI helps to promote the research projects conducted via the consortium through publishing. Finally, the APESCY provides assistance to students whose research interests include intercultural mediation in ethnic conflicts at Yoff.
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      <strong>
                       The consortium has forged relations with many organisations and voluntary institutions, which offer work placement opportunities and share their expertise and experience in the course of the programme
                      </strong>
                      .
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      MITRA students will be awarded their Master’s Degree from
                      <strong>
                       the European consortium universities
                      </strong>
                      where they will spend at least one semester.
                      <strong>
                       The associate member universities
                      </strong>
                      supervise students’ field studies in collaboration with partner institutions. They also play an important role in the programme by organising scientific events or summer schools, as such is the case at the University of the Aegean.
                      <strong>
                       Non-academic associate partners
                      </strong>
                      introduce students to the community and voluntary sector by allowing them to join in their voluntary activities or through work placements: For instance, the IRD is involved in teaching by offering various classes at the UCAD in Dakar. The DIADEM facilitates access to field studies depending on students’ research topics and allows them to participate in the network’s scientific events. The CESPRI helps to promote the research projects conducted via the consortium through publishing. Finally, the APESCY provides assistance to students whose research interests include intercultural mediation in ethnic conflicts at Grand-Yoff.
                     </p>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>

           <div class="page-content">
            <section class="sppb-section margemoins1" id="section-id-1559659707673">
             <div class="sppb-row-overlay">
             </div>
             <div class="sppb-row-container">
              <div class="sppb-row">
               <div class="sppb-col-md-12" id="column-wrap-id-1559659707700">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1559659707700">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </section>
            <section class="sppb-section" id="section-id-1559654311481">
             <div class="sppb-row-container">
              <div class="sppb-row sppb-no-gutter">
               <div class="sppb-col-md-12" id="column-wrap-id-1559654311488">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1559654311488">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1559654311489">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block sections-txt">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <h1 style="text-align: center;">
                      A tailor-made programme
                     </h1>
                     <p>
                      <strong>
                       Students can adapt their mobility choices
                      </strong>
                      to their research topics and the courses offered by the partner universities. Sites of study are chosen with the help of the programme’s teaching staff.
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      This Master’s programme features two majors depending on the main language of instruction. These formats will determine the universities the students will be sent to:
                     </p>
                     <h3 style="color: #544d9b;">
                      <span class="circlenumber">
                       1
                      </span>
                      The French track:
                     </h3>
                     <p>
                      <em>
                       The programme "Identités, intégration, conflits", whose main language of instruction is French, begins at the University of Lille (Semester 1). Semester 2 is spent at Babeș-Bolyai University. In year 2, students select the partner university where they wish to spend semester 3. During semester 4 students return to the countries they spent semesters 1 or 2.
                      </em>
                     </p>
                     <h3 style="color: #544d9b;">
                      <span class="circlenumber">
                       2
                      </span>
                      The English track:
                     </h3>
                     <p>
                      <em>
                       The programme "Migrations, Interculturality, Borderlands", whose main language of instruction is English, begins at the Free University of Brussels (Semester 1). Semester 2 is spent at the University of Wroclaw. In year 2, students select the partner university where they wish to spend semester 3. During semester 4 students return to the countries they spent semesters 1 or 2.
                      </em>
                     </p>
                     <hr class="monhr"/>
                     <p>
                      During
                      <strong>
                       semester 3
                      </strong>
                      , students are expected to follow courses at their mobility university and conduct their field study for their Master’s thesis.
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      The University of Lille supervises each student all along the programme, to ensure their mobility project remains coherent.
                     </p>
                     <p class="small">
                      <strong>
                       * For more information :
                      </strong>
                      : please visit
                      <a href="https://www.univ-lille.fr/formations/fr-17mediationinterculturelleident-104062.html" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
                       the following page
                      </a>
                      on the university curriculum.
                     </p>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </section>
            <div class="sppb-section reverse centautoheigh" id="section-id-1559661171666">
             <div class="sppb-container-inner">
              <div class="sppb-row sppb-no-gutter">
               <div class="sppb-col-md-6" id="column-wrap-id-1559661171675">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1559661171675">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1559661171676">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block sections-txt">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <h2>
                      A mandatory internship
                     </h2>
                     <p>
                      The students must complete a 4-week full-time placement (35 hours a week or equivalent if over a longer time period) with an institution or voluntary organisation of their choosing. This placement needs to be approved by the relevant programme director. It has to be done either between semester 2 and semester 3, or during semester 3, or between semester 3 and semester 4, depending on the student’s mobility programme and the location of the host institution.
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      The placement cannot be done at the expense of the programme and doesn’t exempt students from attending classes. it is to be contracted by both the University of Lille and the host institution. Students are expected to produce a placement report on completion. A defence is organised during semester 4, at least two months prior to the Master’s thesis defence.
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      Students have access to a contact database which includes feedback from previous students and staff on the institutions and organisations with which placements can be arranged.
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      <strong>
                       Placement examples:
                      </strong>
                     </p>
                     <ul class="listeperso2">
                      <li>
                       <a href="https://www.iom.int/fr" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
                        International Organisation for Migration
                       </a>
                       in Senegal
                      </li>
                      <li>
                       <a href="http://www.nascireland.org/">
                        Nasc
                       </a>
                       in Ireland
                      </li>
                      <li>
                       <a href="http://www.epdsae.fr/index.html" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
                        EPDSAE
                       </a>
                      </li>
                     </ul>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="sppb-col-md-6" id="column-wrap-id-1559661171677">
                <div class="sppb-column empty-space-background" id="column-id-1559661171677">
                 <div class="sppb-column-overlay">
                 </div>
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1559661171678">
                   <div class="sppb-empty-space clearfix">
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="sppb-section centautoheigh" id="section-id-1559661918153">
             <div class="sppb-container-inner">
              <div class="sppb-row sppb-no-gutter">
               <div class="sppb-col-md-6" id="column-wrap-id-1559661918154">
                <div class="sppb-column empty-space-background" id="column-id-1559661918154">
                 <div class="sppb-column-overlay">
                 </div>
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1559661918157">
                   <div class="sppb-empty-space clearfix">
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="sppb-col-md-6" id="column-wrap-id-1559661918156">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1559661918156">
                 <div class="sppb-column-overlay">
                 </div>
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1559661918155">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block sections-txt">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <h2>
                      Guidelines for the Master’s thesis
                     </h2>
                     <p>
                      The Master’s research thesis will be
                      <strong>
                       80 to 100 pages long
                      </strong>
                      , appendixes and bibliography excluded. This thesis is to be
                      <strong>
                       the result of students two-year training in theoretical, bibliographical, and empirical research
                      </strong>
                      . Research directions may vary depending on the students’ line of inquiry and topic. Yet, the thesis
                      <strong>
                       must include either a case study or a field study
                      </strong>
                      .
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      The thesis
                      <strong>
                       can be written in either French or English
                      </strong>
                      with both supervisors’ approval. The thesis is to be supervised by two professors from the partner universities. The first supervisor generally is a member of one of the universities where the student spent either semester 1 or semester 2, and the second supervisor is the professor who helped the student conduct their field research in semester 3. The defence committee is composed of both supervisors along with an external examiner, who can either be a third professor or a practitioner from an institutional or voluntary organisation in relation with the student’s research.
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      The
                      <strong>
                       Master’s defence
                      </strong>
                      is to be scheduled
                      <strong>
                       between end of June and mid-July
                      </strong>
                      in year 2. The students studying in Cluj must defend their theses by the UBB defence deadline commonly set late June. Defences are due mi-July at Wroclaw university, late June or early July at the University of Lille. Defences can be organised in September only on very exceptional grounds. If the Master’s thesis has not been defended by the deadline set by the committee, the student will have to repeat the year.
                     </p>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
            <section class="sppb-section" id="section-id-1559661918176">
             <div class="sppb-row-container">
              <div class="sppb-row sppb-no-gutter">
               <div class="sppb-col-md-12" id="column-wrap-id-1559661918160">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1559661918160">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1559661918161">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block sections-txt">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <h2 style="text-align: center;">
                      Several degrees awarded
                     </h2>
                     <p>
                      On completion, students will be awarded two or three degrees depending on the major chosen.
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      Once students have validated the four semesters (120 ECTS), they will be awarded two or three degrees from the universities they studied at, depending on their major:
                     </p>
                     <ul class="listeperso1">
                      <li>
                       <strong>
                        University of Lille:
                       </strong>
                       MA in Social Sciences and Humanities: course on Intercultural Mediation (Identity, Mobility, and conflicts).
                      </li>
                      <li>
                       <strong>
                        Free University of Brussels (FUB):
                       </strong>
                       MA in sociology.
                      </li>
                      <li>
                       <strong>
                        Babeș-Bolyai University in Cluj-Napoca (UBB):
                       </strong>
                       MA in Compared European Political Science (Studii Politice Europene Comparate).
                      </li>
                      <li>
                       <strong>
                        University of Worclaw (UW):
                       </strong>
                       Master’s in Sociology and Specialised Intercultural Mediation.
                      </li>
                      <li>
                       <strong>
                        University of Szeged (SZTE):
                       </strong>
                       MA in European Studies.
                      </li>
                      <li>
                       <strong>
                        University College Cork (UCC):
                       </strong>
                       MA Languages and cultures
                      </li>
                      <li>
                       <strong>
                        University of Grenada (UGR):
                       </strong>
                       MA in Social Development and Intervention in Social Education.
                      </li>
                     </ul>
                     <hr class="monhr"/>
                     <p>
                      <strong>
                       Cheikh Anta Diop University
                      </strong>
                      (Senegal) and
                      <strong>
                       The Federal University of Rio de Janeiro
                      </strong>
                      (Brazil) are also associate partners. They both fully contribute to MITRA and welcome students in semester 3 without offering diploma qualifications though.
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      <strong>
                       The University of the Aegean
                      </strong>
                      is an associate partner and organises a summer school, which qualifies students to European Credits (5 ECTS).
                     </p>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </section>
           </div>

                     <div class="sppb-alert sppb-alert-danger sppb-fade in" style="text-align: center;">

                     </div>
                    </div>

            <section class="sppb-section" id="section-id-1576096049913">
             <div class="sppb-row-container">

                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <p style="text-align: left;">
                      <br/>
                      The admission procedure for the MITRA Master's degree is divided into the following
                      <strong>
                       stages
                      </strong>
                      :
                     </p>
                     <span class="circlenumber">
                      1
                     </span>
                     <strong>
                      Reception of applications
                     </strong>
                     submitted online on the
                     <a href="https://application.master-mitra.eu/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
                      dedicated platform
                     </a>
                     :
                     <br/>
                     <ul>
                      <li>
                       Administrative validation: checking the validity of files
                      </li>
                      <li>
                       Pre-selection of application files
                      </li>
                      <li>
                       Sending out the invitations for the oral interview via skype to the pre-selectioned students
                      </li>
                     </ul>
                     <p>
                      <span class="circlenumber">
                       2
                      </span>
                      <strong>
                       Oral interviews
                      </strong>
                      via Zoom with pre-selected students
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      <span class="circlenumber">
                       3
                      </span>
                      <strong>
                       Diffusion of results
                      </strong>
                      to selected students, as well as non-selected students
                      <em>
                       <br/>
                       <br/>
                      </em>
                      <em>
                       <br/>
                       <br/>
                      </em>
                      <strong>
                       Important :
                      </strong>
                      <em>
                       <br/>
                       <br/>
                      </em>
                      - Applications are open every year from November to February, interviews take place from February.
                      <br/>
                      - Incomplete application files will not be considered.
                     </p>

                   </div>
                  </div>

In particular, certain data of the scholarship holders (students and scholars), non-scholarship holders and reserve list candidates is shared with the Agency through the
                      <a href="https://eacea.ec.europa.eu/mobility/index.cfm" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
                       EACEA Mobility Tool

                      and treated according to the following

                      <br/>
                      <br/>
                      <span style="font-size: 12pt;">
                       ►
                      </span>
                      Curriculum vitae (personnal or made with
                      <a href="https://europass.cedefop.europa.eu/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
                       Europass
                      </a>
                      )
                      <br/>
                      <br/>
                      <span style="font-size: 12pt;">
                       ► Q
                      </span>
                      uality of the previous courses/career (previous transcripts will be needed)
                      <br/>
                      <br/>
                      <span style="font-size: 12pt;">
                       ►
                      </span>
                      Motivation letter (2 pages long)
                      <br/>
                      <br/>
                      <span style="font-size: 12pt;">
                       ►
                      </span>
                      Reference letters : with at least two reference letters written by professors, managers,
                      <em>
                       etc
                      </em>
                      . (from internship, association, work)
                      <br/>
                      <br/>
                      <span style="font-size: 12pt;">
                       ►
                      </span>
                      Diplomas (A-Levels or equivalent, bachelor, master, ph.D)
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      Candidates for Master MITRA must hold a high education diploma issued by a competent High Education authority attesting the completion of a degree equivalent to a 1st cycle (180 ECTS) in the following fields: Languages, Humanities, Social Sciences, Arts, Law, and, by the way of derogation, holders of other bachelors with relevant professional experience.
                      <br/>
                      <br/>
                      <span style="font-size: 12pt;">
                       ►
                      </span>
                      Research project : in adequacy with the MITRA theme/actuality and completed by bibliographic references. The research project is a text of 10,000 characters at most, including the short final bibliography listing relevant references. The project delineates the social study on transnational migrations that you would like to undertake during your time in the MITRA program. You can first present the general theme of the project, then the personal, scientific, and/or political reasons why you think this issue is important, the research hypothesis that should guide you investigation, and lastly the specific object on which you could do fieldwork (i.e., a specific community, a neighborhood, an association, a place, etc.). Keep in mind that this project can evolve and even radically change during your first months in the MITRA program.
                     </p>
                     <div>
                     </div>
                     <p>
                      <br/>
                      <br/>
                      <span style="font-size: 12pt;">
                       ►
                      </span>
                      English level attestation (B2 to C2)
                      <br/>
                      <br/>
                      <span style="font-size: 12pt;">
                       ►
                      </span>
                      French level attestation (B2 to C2)
                      <br/>
                      <br/>
                      Important! MITRA is a bilingual master, and a certificate of minimum level B2 in French and English is required independently of the language patch chosen. We accept any type of certification as long as it is recognized by the issuing country.
                      <br/>
                      The MITRA admission jury does not require proof of French language skills to be provided by an attestation from a specific language certification organisation. However, the official nature of the attestation requested must allow the jury to determine as objectively as possible that at least a B2 level has been obtained by the candidate.
                     </p>

                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <h1 style="text-align: center;">
                      <span style="font-size: 30pt;">
                       How to enrol ?
                      </span>
                     </h1>
                     <p>
                      <br/>
                      Once you have been
                      <a href="/admission-selection/admission">
                       admitted
                      </a>
                      , you will be expected to fill in another enrolling form when you arrive in Lille. You will then need to provide the following supporting documents :
                     </p>
                     <ul class="listeperso1">
                      <li>
                       An ID photograph
                      </li>
                      <li>
                       The original and certified copy of your ID, or visa for non-EU students
                      </li>
                      <li>
                       The original copies of your degrees
                      </li>
                     </ul>

                    </a>

            <section class="sppb-section" id="section-id-1576226817765">
             <div class="sppb-row-container">
              <div class="sppb-row">
               <div class="sppb-col-md-12" id="column-wrap-id-1576226817764">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1576226817764">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1576226817768">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-alert">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <div class="sppb-alert sppb-alert-light sppb-fade in">
                      La
                      <strong>
                       Contribution de Vie Etudiante et de Campus (CVEC)
                      </strong>
                      est un paiement nécessaire pour valider l'inscription administrative à l'Université chaque année.
                      <br/>
                      Elle doit être réglée par les nouveaux arrivants à Lille et à Bruxelles.
                      <br/>
                      En 2019/2020, elle s'élevait à 91 euros.
                      <br/>
                      <br/>
                      Les étudiants boursiers Erasmus Mundus sont exonérés de ces frais et seront remboursés. Les étudiants non boursiers peuvent également profiter de cette exonération et être remboursés.
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </section>
            <section class="sppb-section" id="section-id-1559743240533">
             <div class="sppb-row-container">
              <div class="sppb-row sppb-no-gutter">
               <div class="sppb-col-md-12" id="column-wrap-id-1559743240534">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1559743240534">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1559743240535">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block sections-txt">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <p>
                      You will receive a university card (called multi-service card), which will act as:
                     </p>
                     <ul class="listeperso1" style="margin-bottom: 30px;">
                      <li>
                       Your student card
                      </li>
                      <li>
                       Your library card
                      </li>
                      <li>
                       Your cafeteria (CROUS) card
                      </li>
                     </ul>
                     <p>
                      Once you have your university card, you will be given codes to log onto your personal online workspace (
                      <a href="https://ent.univ-lille.fr/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
                       ENT
                      </a>
                      ). This platform on the university website will give you access to many applications and online resources, including your academic track record, your mailbox, Moodle courses, the library’s resource catalogue, distance documentary resources and the language skills centre. Workshops on how to use these applications will be organised in September.
                     </p>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>

                     <h1 style="text-align: center;">
                      <span style="font-size: 32pt;">
                       Participation costs
                      </span>
                      <br/>
                      <br/>
                     </h1>
                     <ul class="listeperso1">
                      <li>
                       For students from
                       <strong>
                        Erasmus + programmes countries
                       </strong>
                       <sup>
                        (1)
                       </sup>
                       : 2000 euros/semester
                      </li>
                      <li>
                       For students from the
                       <strong>
                        Erasmus + partner countries
                       </strong>
                       <sup>
                        (2)
                       </sup>
                       : 4000 euros/semester
                      </li>
                     </ul>
                     <strong>
                      <br/>
                      <br/>
                      <br/>
                     </strong>
                     <span style="font-size: 12pt;">
                      Important :
                      <br/>
                     </span>
                     <ul>
                      <li>
                       Master candidates can apply for an
                       <strong>
                        Erasmus Mundus scholarship
                       </strong>
                       from the European Commission (see more information on the
                       <a href="/en/application-admission/scolarship" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
                        scolarships page
                       </a>
                       ). This scholarship covers tuition, living expenses and transportation for both years.
                       <strong>
                        Applications
                       </strong>
                       for Erasmus Mundus scholarships are submitted
                       <strong>
                        during
                       </strong>
                       the Master's application
                      </li>
                     </ul>
                     <ul>
                      <li>
                       Exemption from these tuition fees is also possible for students who are not Erasmus Mundus scholarship holders, following an internal exemption procedure at the University of Lille.
                      </li>
                     </ul>
                     <br/>
                     <br/>
                     <br/>
                     <span style="font-size: 10pt;">
                      <sup>
                       (1)
                      </sup>
                      :
                      <strong>
                       Erasmus + programme countries
                      </strong>
                      <strong>
                       pays programmes
                      </strong>
                      correspond to the 28 partner countries of the European Union + Iceland, Norway, Turkey, Serbia, Liechtenstein, and Northern Macedonia.
                     </span>
                     <br/>
                     <span style="font-size: 10pt;">
                      <sup>
                       (2)
                      </sup>
                      :
                      <strong>
                       Erasmus + partner countries
                      </strong>
                      correspond to all other countries.
                      <strong>
                       <br/>
                      </strong>
                      For more information on Erasmus + country eligibility, see the
                      <a href="https://ec.europa.eu/programmes/erasmus-plus/about/who-can-take-part_en" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
                       dedicated page
                      </a>
                      on the European Commission's website.
                     </span>
                     <br/>
                     <br/>

                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1575970079025">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-accordion">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <div class="sppb-panel-group">
                      <div class="sppb-panel sppb-panel-modern">
                       <div aria-controls="sppb-ac-content-1575970079025-key-0" aria-expanded="true" class="sppb-panel-heading active" id="sppb-ac-heading-1575970079025-key-0">
                        <span aria-label="Erasmus Mundus Grant" class="sppb-panel-title">
                         <i aria-hidden="true" class="fa fa-angle-double-right">
                         </i>
                         Erasmus Mundus Grant
                        </span>
                        <span aria-label="Toggle Direction Icon 1" class="sppb-toggle-direction">
                         <i aria-hidden="true" class="fa fa-chevron-right">
                         </i>
                        </span>
                       </div>
                       <div aria-labelledby="sppb-ac-heading-1575970079025-key-0" class="sppb-panel-collapse" id="sppb-ac-content-1575970079025-key-0">
                        <div class="sppb-panel-body">
                         <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1575970079059">
                          <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block">
                           <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                            M
                            <span style="font-size: 11pt;">
                             ITRA applicants can apply for an
                             <strong>
                              Erasmus Mundus scholarship
                             </strong>
                             from the
                             <strong>
                              European Commission
                             </strong>
                             . This scholarship will cover tuition fees, daily and transport expenses for the two years of study.
                            </span>
                            <br/>
                            <br/>
                            <span style="font-size: 11pt;">
                             When applying for MITRA, candidates are invited to apply for an Erasmus Mundus scholarship from the European Commission (limited number of scholarships). This application could not be accepted for a student who has already used a similar scholarship.
                            </span>
                            <br/>
                            <br/>
                            <span style="font-size: 11pt;">
                             This scholarship consists of an annual installation payment as well as a monthly payment:
                            </span>
                           </div>
                          </div>
                         </div>
                         <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1575970079057">
                          <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-image-content aligment-left clearfix">
                           <div aria-label="" class="sppb-image-holder" role="img" style="background-image: url(/images/jch-optimize/ng/images_2020_01_14_capture-nouveau-tableau-3.webp);">
                           </div>
                           <div class="sppb-container">
                            <div class="sppb-row">
                             <div class="sppb-col-sm-6">
                             </div>
                             <div class="sppb-col-sm-6 sppb-col-sm-offset-6">
                              <div class="sppb-content-holder">
                               <p class="sppb-image-content-text">
                                <p>
                                 <span style="font-size: 12pt;">
                                  Important :
                                 </span>
                                </p>
                                <ul>
                                 <li>
                                  <span style="font-size: 10pt;">
                                   Erasmus Mundus scholarship students are exempt from the registration fees indicated on the page "admission fees".
                                  </span>
                                 </li>
                                 <li>
                                  <span style="font-size: 10pt;">
                                   This Erasmus Mundus scholarship is usually accompanied by health and liability insurance covered by the programme.
                                  </span>
                                 </li>
                                 <li>
                                  <span style="font-size: 10pt;">
                                   The amounts received will be fixed throughout the duration of the master (4 semesters).
                                  </span>
                                 </li>
                                </ul>
                               </p>
                              </div>
                             </div>
                            </div>
                           </div>
                          </div>
                         </div>
                         <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1575970079060">
                          <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block">
                           <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                            <span style="font-size: 8pt;">
                             * Contribution to subsistence costs will not be given to the scholarship holders for the EMJMD periods (study/research/placement/thesis preparation) spent in their country of residence, nor to scholarship holders from a Partner Country for the EMJMD periods exceeding one trimester (i.e. 3 months or the equivalent of 15 ECTS credits) spent in any Partner Country.
                             <br/>
                            </span>
                           </div>
                          </div>

            <section class="sppb-section" id="section-id-1579008102274">
             <div class="sppb-row-container">
              <div class="sppb-row">
               <div class="sppb-col-md-12" id="column-wrap-id-1579008102275">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1579008102275">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1579008102276">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-accordion">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <div class="sppb-panel-group">
                      <div class="sppb-panel sppb-panel-modern">
                       <div aria-controls="sppb-ac-content-1579008102276-key-0" aria-expanded="true" class="sppb-panel-heading active" id="sppb-ac-heading-1579008102276-key-0">
                        <span aria-label="Erasmus + grant" class="sppb-panel-title">
                         <i aria-hidden="true" class="fa fa-angle-double-right">
                         </i>
                         Erasmus + grant
                        </span>
                        <span aria-label="Toggle Direction Icon 1" class="sppb-toggle-direction">
                         <i aria-hidden="true" class="fa fa-chevron-right">
                         </i>
                        </span>
                       </div>
                       <div aria-labelledby="sppb-ac-heading-1579008102276-key-0" class="sppb-panel-collapse" id="sppb-ac-content-1579008102276-key-0">
                        <div class="sppb-panel-body">
                         <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1575974318277">
                          <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block">
                           <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                            <span style="font-size: 11pt;">
                             Admitted students can obtain an Erasmus + scholarship for a one-semester mobility in one of the partner universities in Europe. Granted by the European Union, this allowance ranges from €170 to €270 per month depending on the country of destination.
                            </span>
                            <br/>
                            <br/>
                            <span style="font-size: 11pt;">
                             In 2018/2019, the amounts were as follows:
                            </span>
                           </div>
                          </div>
                         </div>
                         <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1575974318278">
                          <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-image-content aligment-left clearfix">
                           <div aria-label="" class="sppb-image-holder" role="img" style="background-image: url(/images/jch-optimize/ng/images_2019_12_10_2019-12-10-11__45__30-sans-titre6.webp);">
                           </div>
                           <div class="sppb-container">
                            <div class="sppb-row">
                             <div class="sppb-col-sm-6">
                             </div>
                             <div class="sppb-col-sm-6 sppb-col-sm-offset-6">
                              <div class="sppb-content-holder">
                               <p class="sppb-image-content-text">
                                <p class="sppb-image-content-text">
                                 <span style="font-size: 12pt;">
                                  Important :
                                 </span>
                                </p>
                                <ul>
                                 <li>
                                  <span style="font-size: 10pt;">
                                   This scholarship can be combined with other scholarships:
                                  </span>
                                  <br/>
                                  <ul>
                                   <li>
                                    <span style="font-size: 10pt;">
                                     The regional scolarship called "Mermoz"
                                    </span>
                                   </li>
                                   <li>
                                    <span style="font-size: 10pt;">
                                     <strong>
                                      or
                                     </strong>
                                     with the International Mobility Assistance (IMA)
                                    </span>
                                   </li>
                                  </ul>
                                 </li>
                                 <li>
                                  <span style="font-size: 10pt;">
                                   To apply for the Erasmus + scholarship, it is necessary to first contact the
                                   <strong>
                                    international relations department
                                   </strong>
                                   of your component/faculty. The rest of the steps will be done
                                   <strong>
                                    online
                                   </strong>
                                   via the Digital Working Environment.
                                  </span>
                                 </li>
                                 <li>
                                  <span style="font-size: 10pt;">
                                   Amounts may vary from year to year.
                                  </span>
                                 </li>
                                 <li>
                                  <span style="font-size: 10pt;">
                                   More information about the Erasmus + scholarship can be found on the International Relations website : "
                                   <a href="https://international.univ-lille.fr/partir-a-letranger/preparer-et-financer-ma-mobilite/">
                                    finance my mobility
                                   </a>
                                   ".
                                  </span>
                                 </li>
                                </ul>
                               </p>
                              </div>
                             </div>
                            </div>
                           </div>
                          </div>
                         </div>
                        </div>
                       </div>
                      </div>
                      <div class="sppb-panel sppb-panel-modern">
                       <div aria-controls="sppb-ac-content-1579008102276-key-1" aria-expanded="false" class="sppb-panel-heading" id="sppb-ac-heading-1579008102276-key-1">
                        <span aria-label="Regional scolarship" class="sppb-panel-title">
                         <i aria-hidden="true" class="fa fa-angle-double-right">
                         </i>
                         Regional scolarship
                        </span>
                        <span aria-label="Toggle Direction Icon 2" class="sppb-toggle-direction">
                         <i aria-hidden="true" class="fa fa-chevron-right">
                         </i>
                        </span>
                       </div>
                       <div aria-labelledby="sppb-ac-heading-1579008102276-key-1" class="sppb-panel-collapse" id="sppb-ac-content-1579008102276-key-1" style="display: none;">
                        <div class="sppb-panel-body">
                         <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1575970079061">
                          <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block">
                           <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                            <span style="font-size: 11pt;">
                             The Regional Council of Hauts-de-France provides some students with a mobility grant:
                             <strong>
                              the Mermoz grant
                             </strong>
                             . It is awarded according to the following criteria:
                            </span>
                            <br/>
                            <ul>
                             <li>
                              <span style="font-size: 11pt;">
                               <strong>
                                Under means-tested conditions:
                               </strong>
                               the amount of the grant is calculated according to the family quotient.
                              </span>
                             </li>
                             <li>
                              <span style="font-size: 11pt;">
                               <strong>
                                Residence requirement
                               </strong>
                               : it is necessary to be a resident of the Hauts-de-France.
                              </span>
                             </li>
                             <li>
                              <span style="font-size: 11pt;">
                               <strong>
                                Depending on the country of destination
                               </strong>
                               : all countries are eligible except the French overseas departments and territories, the principality of Monaco and Andorra.
                              </span>
                             </li>
                            </ul>
                            <span style="font-size: 11pt;">
                             Its amount varies according to the case and can amount to up to 400 euros per month. Eligible students and scholarships based on social criteria receive an additional contribution of around 300 euros towards travel expenses.
                            </span>
                            <br/>
                            <br/>
                            <span style="font-size: 11pt;">
                             Students may also apply for this scholarship in the case of an
                             <strong>
                              internship mobility
                             </strong>
                             or a
                             <strong>
                              research stay
                             </strong>
                             . However, a student may only benefit from Mermoz regional international mobility assistance once (internship, study stay) even if the maximum duration of 26 weeks has not been reached.
                            </span>
                            <br/>
                            <br/>
                            <div>
                             <span style="font-size: 11pt;">
                             </span>
                            </div>
                            <blockquote>
                             <div>
                              <span style="font-size: 11pt;">
                               <a href="http://guide-aides.hautsdefrance.fr/aide613" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
                                More information about Mermoz
                               </a>
                               (in French)
                              </span>
                              <br/>
                              <span style="font-size: 11pt;">
                               <a href="https://aidesindividuelles.hautsdefrance.fr/sub/extranet/dispositif-consulter.sub?sigle=MERMOZ20" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
                                Perform a simulation
                               </a>
                               (in French)
                               <a href="https://aidesindividuelles.hautsdefrance.fr/sub/extranet/dispositif-consulter.sub?sigle=MERMOZ20">
                                <br/>
                               </a>
                               <a href="http://guide-aides.hautsdefrance.fr/spip.php?page=fichier_dispositif&fichier_dispositif=1756" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
                                Mermoz FAQ
                               </a>
                              </span>
                              <br/>
                              <span style="font-size: 11pt;">
                               <a href="http://guide-aides.hautsdefrance.fr/spip.php?page=fichier_dispositif&fichier_dispositif=1761" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
                                Consult the regulations for the award of scholarship (2019/2020)
                               </a>
                              </span>
                             </div>
                            </blockquote>
                           </div>
                          </div>
                         </div>
                        </div>
                       </div>
                      </div>
                      <div class="sppb-panel sppb-panel-modern">
                       <div aria-controls="sppb-ac-content-1579008102276-key-2" aria-expanded="false" class="sppb-panel-heading" id="sppb-ac-heading-1579008102276-key-2">
                        <span aria-label="International Mobility Assistance (AMI)" class="sppb-panel-title">
                         <i aria-hidden="true" class="fa fa-angle-double-right">
                         </i>
                         International Mobility Assistance (AMI)
                        </span>
                        <span aria-label="Toggle Direction Icon 3" class="sppb-toggle-direction">
                         <i aria-hidden="true" class="fa fa-chevron-right">
                         </i>
                        </span>
                       </div>
                       <div aria-labelledby="sppb-ac-heading-1579008102276-key-2" class="sppb-panel-collapse" id="sppb-ac-content-1579008102276-key-2" style="display: none;">
                        <div class="sppb-panel-body">
                         <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1575970079062">
                          <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block">
                           <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                            <span style="font-size: 11pt;">
                             This scholarship is only for students who are already awarded scholarships on social criteria. It is awarded for abroad
                             <strong>
                              study periods
                             </strong>
                             or
                             <strong>
                              internships
                             </strong>
                             .
                            </span>
                            <br/>
                            <br/>
                            <span style="font-size: 11pt;">
                             This assistance may be paid several times up to a total of 9 cumulative months (e.g. 6 months of mobility and 3 months of internship).
                            </span>
                            <br/>
                            <br/>
                            <span style="font-size: 11pt;">
                             For the academic year 2019/2020, its amount was 400 euros per month. Depending on the student's resources, this amount can be allocated for up to 9 months. At least, it is granted for 2 months (even if the mobility exceeds this period).
                            </span>
                            <br/>
                            <br/>
                            <br/>
                            <blockquote>
                             <span style="font-size: 11pt;">
                              <a href="https://www.service-public.fr/particuliers/vosdroits/F380">
                               Detailed information
                              </a>
                              (in French)
                              <a href="https://www.service-public.fr/particuliers/vosdroits/F380" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
                               <br/>
                              </a>
                              <a href="https://www.service-public.fr/particuliers/vosdroits/F12214" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
                               Find out more about the scolarship on social criteria
                              </a>
                              (in French)
                             </span>
                            </blockquote>
                           </div>
                          </div>
                         </div>
                        </div>
                       </div>
                      </div>
                      <div class="sppb-panel sppb-panel-modern">
                       <div aria-controls="sppb-ac-content-1579008102276-key-3" aria-expanded="false" class="sppb-panel-heading" id="sppb-ac-heading-1579008102276-key-3">
                        <span aria-label="Moblilex grant" class="sppb-panel-title">
                         <i aria-hidden="true" class="fa fa-angle-double-right">
                         </i>
                         Moblilex grant
                        </span>
                        <span aria-label="Toggle Direction Icon 4" class="sppb-toggle-direction">
                         <i aria-hidden="true" class="fa fa-chevron-right">
                         </i>
                        </span>
                       </div>
                       <div aria-labelledby="sppb-ac-heading-1579008102276-key-3" class="sppb-panel-collapse" id="sppb-ac-content-1579008102276-key-3" style="display: none;">
                        <div class="sppb-panel-body">
                         <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1575970079063">
                          <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block">
                           <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                            <span style="font-size: 11pt;">
                             The mobility grants called Moblilex are administered subject to validation by the Board of Directors of the University of Lille. The objective of the scheme is to support, on the basis of
                             <strong>
                              project excellence
                             </strong>
                             , the international mobility of students from the University of Lille and its partner universities.
                            </span>
                            <br/>
                            <br/>
                            <span style="font-size: 11pt;">
                             MITRA students are eligible for this scholarship during their mobility for
                             <strong>
                              semester 3
                             </strong>
                             .
                            </span>
                            <br/>
                            <br/>
                            <blockquote>
                             <span style="font-size: 11pt;">
                              <a href="https://international.univ-lille.fr/fileadmin/user_upload/docs__pdf__autre_/international/docs/MOBLILEX_2019_2020_eng.pdf">
                               More information in English
                              </a>
                             </span>
                            </blockquote>
                           </div>
                          </div>
                         </div>
                        </div>
                       </div>
                      </div>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </section>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>

                      </noscript>

               <div class="sppb-col-md-9" id="column-wrap-id-1572427001353">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1572427001353">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1572427001354">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block sections-txt">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <h3>
                      AUDREY CELESTINE
                      <br/>
                      <span style="font-size: 12pt;">
                       <em>
                        <span class="st">
                         University of Lille
                        </span>
                       </em>
                      </span>
                     </h3>
                     As a doctor of political science at the IEP in Paris, I defended a thesis on the links between mobilization processes and identity building among the West Indies in France and Puerto Ricans in the United States. My current research has two main areas of focus. On the one hand, it is a historical sociology of the State in France and the United States from their Caribbean territories (French West Indies and Puerto Rico) and on the other hand, an analysis of the various issues raised by the Black Lives Matter movement in the United States (with my colleague Nicolas Martin-Breteau).
                     <br/>
                     <br/>
                     Personal website:
                     <a href="https://dyspo.hypotheses.org/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
                      Social and Political Dynamics in Overseas
                     </a>
                     <br/>
                     <br/>
                     <p style="text-align: right;">
                      <em>
                       <a href="https://pro.univ-lille.fr/audrey-celestine/">
                        Source
                       </a>
                      </em>
                     </p>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="sppb-section sppb-section-content-center" id="section-id-1559900355639">
             <div class="sppb-container-inner">
              <div class="sppb-row sppb-no-gutter sppb-align-center">
               <div class="sppb-col-md-3" id="column-wrap-id-1559900355644">

                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">

                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-single-image sppb-text-center sections-img">
