                      <img alt="Nicolas Martin-Breteau" class="sppb-img-responsive jch-lazyload" data-src="/images/jch-optimize/ng/images_2019_06_07_nicolas-martin-breteau.webp" height="200" src="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHdpZHRoPSIyMDAiIGhlaWdodD0iMjAwIj48L3N2Zz4=" title="" width="200"/>
                      <noscript>
                       <img alt="Nicolas Martin-Breteau" class="sppb-img-responsive" height="200" src="/images/jch-optimize/ng/images_2019_06_07_nicolas-martin-breteau.webp" title="" width="200"/>
                      </noscript>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="sppb-col-md-9" id="column-wrap-id-1559900355646">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1559900355646">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1559900355647">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block sections-txt">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <h3>
                      NICOLAS MARTIN-BRETEAU
                      <br/>
                      <span style="font-size: 12pt;">
                       <em>
                        University of Lille
                        <br/>
                       </em>
                      </span>
                     </h3>
                     <p>
                      Nicolas Martin-Breteau is a historian of the United States, a lecturer at the University of Lille and a member of the Centre d'études en civilisations langues et lettres étrangères (CECILLE).
                      <br/>
                      <br/>
                      As a Fulbright laureate, he has been a visiting scholar at the University of Maryland at College Park (2009-2010) and at the University of Massachusetts at Amherst (2020).
                      <br/>
                      <br/>
                      His researches focus on African-American history and the history of racism.
                      <br/>
                      <br/>
                      The book based on his doctoral thesis on the political role of the sports community in African-American mobilization since the end of the 19th century, will soon be published by EHESS Publishing and Johns Hopkins University Press. He is currently working on a biography of W. E. B. Du Bois, a history of racial prejudice in the United States, and research on the Black Lives Matter movement. His critical translation of W. E. B. Du Bois' book, The Philadephia Negro (1899), was published in 2019 by Éditions La Découverte.
                      <br/>
                      <br/>
                     </p>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>

                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">

                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-single-image sppb-text-left sections-img">

               <div class="sppb-col-md-9" id="column-wrap-id-1572427001425">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1572427001425">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1572427001426">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block sections-txt">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <h3>
                      ASUNCION FRESNOZA-FLOT
                      <br/>
                      <span style="font-size: 12pt;">
                       <em>
                        <span class="st">
                         Free University of Brussels
                         <br/>
                        </span>
                       </em>
                      </span>
                     </h3>
                     <p>
                      Asuncion Fresnoza-Flot has obtained her PhD in Sociology from Paris Diderot-Paris 7 University in 2008 in France. Since 2017, she is FNRS research associate and works at the Laboratory of Anthropology of Contemporary Worlds (LAMC) at the Université libre de Bruxelles (ULB) where she teaches the course
                      <strong>
                       “Migration and gender”
                      </strong>
                      (GENR-D401) and the module 1
                      <strong>
                       “Intermarriages ‘mixed’ families and migration”
                      </strong>
                      of the Seminar of Anthropology 1 (SOCA-D307). She is
                      <strong>
                       pedagogical coordinator of the Master Erasmus Mundus "Migrations Transnationales" (MITRA)
                      </strong>
                      at ULB and vice-president of the Ethics Committee of the Faculty of Philosophy and Social Sciences at the same university. She is also member of the editorial committee of the journals
                      <em>
                       Civilisations
                      </em>
                      (international review on anthropology and human sciences) and
                      <em>
                       Sextant
                      </em>
                      (multidisciplinary and international journal specialized in women and gender studies). In her research, she is currently focusing on
                      <strong>
                       Belgian-Asian couples in Belgium and Asia
                      </strong>
                      (website of the project:
                      <a href="https://belmix.net/">
                       https://belmix.net/
                      </a>
                      ) as part of a research programme on the contextual mobility of migrants and their families.
                     </p>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>

                     <div class="sppb-addon-single-image-container">
                      <img alt="Sergiu Miscoiu" class="sppb-img-responsive jch-lazyload" data-src="/images/jch-optimize/ng/images_2019_06_07_sergiu-miscoiu.webp" height="200" src="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHdpZHRoPSIyMDAiIGhlaWdodD0iMjAwIj48L3N2Zz4=" title="" width="200"/>
                      <noscript>
                       <img alt="Sergiu Miscoiu" class="sppb-img-responsive" height="200" src="/images/jch-optimize/ng/images_2019_06_07_sergiu-miscoiu.webp" title="" width="200"/>
                      </noscript>

               </div>
               <div class="sppb-col-md-9" id="column-wrap-id-1559900355645">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1559900355645">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1559900355646">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block sections-txt">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <h3>
                      SERGIU MISCOIU
                      <br/>
                      <span style="font-size: 12pt;">
                       <em>
                        <span class="st">
                         Babeș-Bolyai University
                        </span>
                       </em>
                      </span>
                     </h3>
                     <p>
                      <br/>
                      Sergiu Mişcoiu is a university professor in political science at the Faculty of European Studies of Babes-Bolyai University (UBB, Cluj-Napoca, Romania) and director of the Centre for International Cooperation of this university.
                      <br/>
                      <br/>
                      In 2006, he obtained a PhD in political science (at the University of Paris-Est) and a PhD in history (at the University Babes-Bolyai) for a thesis on national construction in Europe. Since October 2010, he has been qualified to direct research (HDR) at the University of Paris-Est, his habilitation thesis on populism captured by discourse theory. Since 2012, he has also been directing theses in political science at Babes-Bolyai University. From 2012 to 2016, he was at the head of the UBB's International Relations Department and since 2016, he has been the Director of the UBB International Cooperation Centre. He is also a member of the Research Team of the Laboratoire Interdisciplinaire de l'Etude du Politique (LIPHA) of the Université Paris-Est, Director of the Centre de Réussite Universitaire and the Centre d'Etudes Africaines of the Université Babes-Bolyai and Editor-in-Chief of the scientific journal Studia Europaea.
                      <br/>
                      <br/>
                      Her research topics are the theories of populism, radicalism and extremism and political transitions in the French-speaking countries of Central and Eastern Europe and Africa, which are treated in a comparative manner. He has written four books, edited and co-edited twenty other volumes and written fifty scientific articles.
                      <br/>
                      <br/>
                      Faculty of European Studies
                      <br/>
                      Babes-Bolyai University
                      <br/>
                      1 rue E. de Martonne 400090 Cluj-Napoca Romania
                      <br/>
                      Phone office +40264 405 300 * 5972
                     </p>

                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>

            <div class="sppb-section sppb-section-content-center" id="section-id-1560249337653">

              <div class="sppb-row sppb-no-gutter sppb-align-center">
               <div class="sppb-col-md-3" id="column-wrap-id-1560249337654">

                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1560249337655">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-single-image sppb-text-center sections-img">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <div class="sppb-addon-single-image-container">
                      <img alt="Péter Kruzslicz" class="sppb-img-responsive jch-lazyload" data-src="/images/jch-optimize/ng/images_2021_12_13_peter-kruzslicz.webp" height="285" src="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHdpZHRoPSIzODAiIGhlaWdodD0iMjg1Ij48L3N2Zz4=" title="" width="380"/>
                      <noscript>
                       <img alt="Péter Kruzslicz" class="sppb-img-responsive" height="285" src="/images/jch-optimize/ng/images_2021_12_13_peter-kruzslicz.webp" title="" width="380"/>
                      </noscript>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="sppb-col-md-9" id="column-wrap-id-1560249337656">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1560249337656">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1560249337657">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block sections-txt">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <h3>
                      PÉTER PÁL KRUZSLICZ
                      <br/>
                      <span style="font-size: 12pt;">
                       <em>
                        University of Szeged
                       </em>
                      </span>
                     </h3>
                     <p style="text-align: justify;">
                      Péter Pál Kruzslicz is a senior lecturer at the
                      <strong>
                       Faculty of Law and Political Sciences (International and Regional Studies Institute) of the University of Szeged
                      </strong>
                      , he is director of French-speaking study programmes at the same faculty and director of the
                      <strong>
                       Francophone University Centre
                      </strong>
                      of the same University.
                      <br/>
                      <br/>
                      He got a legal degree (dr. jur.) at the University of Szeged and a Master in European law at the University Jean Moulin Lyon 3. He followed his doctoral studies at those two universities, and he got a PhD degree in public law. He works at the University of Szeged as a lecturer, researcher, and he has several administrative responsibilities, especially as regards to the development of international relations of the University. He teaches lectures in
                      <strong>
                       comparative constitutional law and European law
                      </strong>
                      for Master students in Hungarian, English, and French. His research is conducted on the field of intersection of the constitutional and European law (national sovereignty, constitutional identity, the relations between national and European law), he has been interested on
                      <strong>
                       migration related legal issues
                      </strong>
                      for the last five years with regard to his initial subject of interest, he is also working for the last couple of years about institutional questions, especially
                      <strong>
                       democratic challenges in contemporary States in Central Europe and in the institutional and legal system of European integration.
                      </strong>
                      He is involved in numerous international research projects and publishes in Hungarian, in French and in English.
                     </p>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
            <section class="sppb-section" id="section-id-1662120140298">

              <div class="sppb-row">

                      <img alt="Mamadou Bouna Timera" class="sppb-img-responsive jch-lazyload" data-src="/images/2022/09/02/mamadou-bouna-timera.png" height="781" src="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHdpZHRoPSIxMTE0IiBoZWlnaHQ9Ijc4MSI+PC9zdmc+" title="" width="1114"/>

               <div class="sppb-col-md-6" id="column-wrap-id-1662120140297">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1662120140297">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1662120140304">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <span style="font-size: 14pt;">
                      <strong>
                       MAMADOU BOUNA TIMERA
                      </strong>
                     </span>
                     <br/>
                     <strong>
                      <em>
                       <span style="font-size: 12pt;">
                        Université Cheikh Anta Diop de Dakar
                       </span>
                       <br/>
                       <br/>
                      </em>
                     </strong>
                     Coordinator of the Mitra Master in Senegal, Mamadou Bouna TIMERA is a lecturer in geography. He currently holds the position of Assessor (Vice-Dean) of the
                     <strong>
                      Faculty of Letters and Human Sciences of Cheikh Anta Diop University in Dakar.
                     </strong>
                     Specialist in didactics of geography and
                     <strong>
                      Inspector General of Education and Training (IGEF)
                     </strong>
                     , he is interested in the fields of human geography and education issues. His work focuses on school knowledge and on questions of identity, territorial constructions and spatial mutations. Member of the
                     <strong>
                      National Border Management Commission of Senegal
                     </strong>
                     for more than ten years, he shares within the Master the experience of border management in the West African context.
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>

                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <h3>
                      PAPE SAKHO
                      <br/>
                      <span style="font-size: 12pt;">
                       <em>
                        <span class="st">
                         Cheikh Anta Diop University
                        </span>
                       </em>
                      </span>
                     </h3>
                     <br/>
                     Dr Pape Sakho is a geographer and researcher at the Faculty of Arts and Human Sciences of the Cheikh Anta Diop University in Dakar since 1996. He is currently Director of Studies at the Population Institute (IPDSR). Her work focuses on urbanization, urban mobility, internal and international migration and population/development issues in Africa and particularly in Senegal. In recent years, he has also taken a great interest in the relationship between the different temporalities and scales of mobility that guide him towards a new field, the re-territorialization through mobility in a globalized space in which African cities are increasingly integrated.
                     <br/>
                     <br/>
                     <p style="text-align: right;">
                      <em>
                       <a href="http://www.migration4development.org/fr/expert/m-pape-sakho" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
                        Source
                       </a>
                      </em>
                     </p>

                     <h3>

                      <br/>
                      <span style="font-size: 12pt;">
                       <em>
                        <span class="st">
                         Federal University of Rio de Janeiro
                        </span>
                       </em>
                      </span>
                     </h3>
                     <p>
                      Mohammed ElHajji is Full Professor of the Doctoral Programmes in Communication and Culture (PPGCOM) and Social Psychology (EICOS) at the Federal University of Rio de Janeiro. Coordinator of the Community Communication Studies Laboratory of the same university (LECC), he is also thesis Director and Researcher at the National Center for Scientific Research of Brazil (CNPq). Coordinator of the Transnational Migration Forum and the Migration Research Symposium and specialist in Transnational Migration and Intercultural Communication.
                     </p>

   <section class="g-flushed" id="g-features">
    <div class="g-container">
     <div class="g-grid">
      <div class="g-block size-100">
       <div class="g-content">
        <div class="platform-content row-fluid">
         <div class="span12">
          <div class="sp-page-builder page-17" id="sp-page-builder">
           <div class="page-content">
            <section class="sppb-section" id="section-id-1662457594891">
             <div class="sppb-row-container">
              <div class="sppb-row">
               <div class="sppb-col-md-12" id="column-wrap-id-1662457594890">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1662457594890">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1662457594894">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block">
                    <h2 class="sppb-addon-title">
                     Call for Scholar candidates MITRA

Second semester of Academic year 2022-2023
                    </h2>
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <p>
                      Within the EMJMD (Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree) MITRA – Transnational Migrations framework,
                      <strong>
                       scholarships
                      </strong>
                      offered by the European Commission will be awarded to European and third-country scholars (academics and professionals) in accordance with the following criteria:
                     </p>
                     <ul>
                      <li>
                       Scholarships can be awarded to scholars enrolled in any third-country HEI [1] who will be selected by the MITRA consortium to contribute to the joint programme within the European partner institutions.
                      </li>
                     </ul>
                     <p>
                      The amount of the remuneration is determined according to the amounts of coverage set by the European Union. The scholarship covers the travel price and the cost of accommodation and food per day, according to the calculations set by the EACEA.
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      The programme provides for three types of physical mobility:
                     </p>
                     <ul>
                      <li>
                       <strong>
                        Long-term mobility: duration 14 days/ 12 to 16 hours of teaching
                       </strong>
                      </li>
                      <li>
                       <strong>
                        Intermediate mobility: 7 days / 6 to 8 teaching hours
                       </strong>
                      </li>
                      <li>
                       <strong>
                        Short mobility: 3 days / 3 to 4 hours of instruction
                       </strong>
                      </li>
                     </ul>
                     <p>
                      The programme also provides for the possibility of exceptional long-distance mobility, in times of health crises preventing international mobility only. In this case, the amount of the grant is calculated on the basis of the teaching hours given (see Annex 2).
                      <br/>
                      EMMC scholars holding an Erasmus Mundus scholarship must:
                     </p>
                     <ul>
                      <li>
                       Commit themselves to actively participate in the master's course activities https://master-mitra.eu/fr/
                      </li>
                      <li>
                       Perform teaching/research/student tutoring activities
                      </li>
                      <li>
                       Contribute, after their visiting scholar activities, to the promotion and dissemination of the Erasmus Mundus Programme in general, and of MITRA in particular, in their HEI and countries of origin.
                      </li>
                     </ul>
                     <p>
                      Applicants will be selected on the basis of compatibility of their experience with the MITRA curriculum:
                     </p>
                     <ul>
                      <li>
                       On the theme of transnational migrations in order to question the social and cultural changes and resulting policies that now extend to the global society.
                      </li>
                      <li>
                       And/or specific themes in relation to international migrations
                      </li>
                     </ul>
                     <p>
                      Teaching will be in French or in English
                     </p>
                     <br/>
                     <strong>
                      The mobility will be effective from February to June 2023 (semester 2)
                     </strong>
                     in one of the following universities:
                     <br/>
                     <br/>
                     <strong>
                      -
                      <a href="https://uwr.edu.pl/en/">
                       University of Wroclaw
                      </a>
                      in Poland
                     </strong>
                     <br/>
                     <strong>
                      -
                      <a href="https://www.ubbcluj.ro/en/">
                       Babes-Bolyai University in Cluj-Napoca
                      </a>
                      in Romania
                     </strong>
                     <br/>
                     <br/>
                     <p>
                      Check-list of documents required for applications: (in English or French)
                     </p>
                     <ul>
                      <li>
                       Letter of intent including the place, duration, dates and speciality of the master concerned
                      </li>
                      <li>
                       A detailed description of the applicant’s possible contribution to the MITRA Master Course
                      </li>
                      <li>
                       Modalities of participation in the fields of research linked to MITRA
                      </li>
                      <li>
                       CV
                      </li>
                      <li>
                       Two publications
                      </li>
                     </ul>
                     <p>
                      Interested scholars must apply to the MITRA Consortium by sending the complete scanned application package in one PDF documents to mitra@univ-lille.fr
                     </p>
                     <strong>
                      Deadline for sending applications: September 30, 2022 – 10:00 a.m. (Paris time)
                     </strong>
                     <br/>
                     <br/>
                     <strong>
                      The application files will be submitted and evaluated by the coordinators of the host university
                     </strong>
                     <br/>
                     <br/>
                     <strong>
                      For further information, please contact:
                      <a href="mailto:mitra@univ-lille.fr">
                       mitra@univ-lille.fr
                       <br/>
                       <br/>
                      </a>
                      Results will be communicated at the beginning of October
                     </strong>
                     <br/>
                     <p>
                      Footnotes
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      [1] Third-country scholars : scholars enrolled in higher education institutions from countries other than a Member State of the European Union or an EEA-EFTA State (Iceland, Norway, and Lichtenstein), who are neither residents nor have carried out their main activity for more than a total of 12 months as from the 28th of February 2010 in one of these countries.
                     </p>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </section>

            <section class="sppb-section" id="section-id-1559745539488">
             <div class="sppb-row-container">
              <div class="sppb-row sppb-no-gutter">
               <div class="sppb-col-md-12" id="column-wrap-id-1559745539489">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1559745539489">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1559745539490">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block sections-txt animated fadeIn duration1 eds-on-scroll">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <p>
                      <a href="http://mitrajectoires.org/fr/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
                       Mitrajectoires
                      </a>
                      is a student society with gathers students and alumni. It aims to foster integration and help develop voluntary projects on migration.
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      Students have carried out work for instance at the Calais refugee camp before it was closed down in 2016. They also worked alongside local associations to help isolated underage refugees in a park located in the urban area of Lille. They have set up language classes grounded in reciprocity and collaborative learning: students would learn Arabic with people in exile, to whom they taught French in return.
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      The Mitrajectories permanent committee has recently opened an office on the campus of the university of Lille to help students in exile to go through administrative procedures (claiming benefits or getting a public transport card for instance). In short, the aim is to help them navigate every day procedures on their own.
                     </p>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </section>

               <div class="sppb-col-md-9" id="column-wrap-id-1559748470526">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1559748470526">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1559748470527">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block sections-txt3">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <h3>
                      MADIHA KASSAWAT
                     </h3>
                     <p>
                      <em>
                       Promotion 2015-2017
                      </em>
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      A native of Syria, Madiha Kassawat joined the Master in 2015. After a first semester in Lille (ULille), she studied at the University of Wrocław in the second semester, then at the University of Cork in the third semester before returning to Lille to write her master thesis that she summarizes in a few lines:
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      "My research is about integrating the immigrant perspective. I am interested in the mechanisms they adopt to integrate - notably through their language skills and communication, but also in their conceptualization of integration and identity. A case study focuses on non-refugee Syrian immigrants in Ireland. "
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      The title of his thesis: "What is integration? Ask an immigrant!"
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      She also has done an internship in Cork as an interpreter in Arabic and English and as an intercultural mediator with Nasc Ireland's lawyers. Nasc is a non-governmental organization working to promote migrant people's access to fundamental rights and advocate for better integration.
                     </p>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="sppb-section sppb-section-content-center" id="section-id-1559750932647">

                      <img alt="Bojana Bulatovic" class="sppb-img-responsive jch-lazyload" data-src="/images/jch-optimize/ng/images_2019_06_05_bojana-bulatovic.webp" height="200" src="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHdpZHRoPSIyMDAiIGhlaWdodD0iMjAwIj48L3N2Zz4=" title="" width="200"/>

                      </noscript>

                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="sppb-col-md-9" id="column-wrap-id-1559750932650">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1559750932650">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1559750932651">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block sections-txt3">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <h3>
                      BOJANA BULATOVIC
                     </h3>
                     <p>
                      <em>
                       Promotion 2014-2016
                      </em>
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      Ms Bulatovic holds MSc in Intercultural Mediation Migration, Identities, Conflicts from KU Leuven, Universidade Federal do Rio de Janeiro and Université Lille 3. She graduated from the Faculty of French Language and Literature, University of Montenegro.
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      From 2006 until 2008, she attended Jonkoping School for Education and Communication course on Leadership and Development Community Youth Work in Montenegro. For nine months, she was a volunteer of European Voluntary Service in a District House in Clermont-Ferrand, France.
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      From 2009 until 2014 she has been working as Advisor for International Cooperation in Directorate for Youth and Sports of Ministry of Education of Montenegro. She contributed to the implementation of the first strategy on youth, participated in creation of the first Law on Youth. She took part in CoE co-management structure Joint Steering Committee on Youth.
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      In 2013, she participated in European Fund for the Balkans Fellowship Programme for Young Government Officials and had three months long insight in the work of German Federal Ministry for Family Affairs, Senior Citizens, Women and Youth.
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      From 2010 until 2014 she volunteered in Initiative Group Alpbach Podgorica, member of European Forum Alpbach network in order to contribute to the reconciliation process in the region.
                     </p>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>

                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1559750932678">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block sections-txt3">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <h3>
                      KOSTIA LENNES
                     </h3>
                     <p>
                      <em>
                       Promotion 2014-2016
                      </em>
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      Originally from France, Kostia Lennes joined the Master in 2014. He spent the first semester at (ULille), than studied at Louvain (KUL) in the second semester, in Mexico City (UNAM) in the third semester before returning to Louvain at fourth semester.
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      He wrote his memoir on "Intimate Homosexual Travel: Trajectories of Identity and Desire among Mexicans Returning from the United States".
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      After Mitra, Kostia performed a 6-month civic service (October 2016-April 2017) in the Generic Association (Immigration History) in Paris.
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      He is currently working as an intercultural mediator and social anthropologist for the Ethnart Association in Paris.
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      In the long term, Kostia plans to do a doctorate in Anthropology of Migration on Gender and Sexuality.
                     </p>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>

            <div class="sppb-section sppb-section-content-center" id="section-id-1571134868241">
             <div class="sppb-container-inner">
              <div class="sppb-row sppb-no-gutter sppb-align-center">
               <div class="sppb-col-md-3" id="column-wrap-id-1571134868242">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1571134868242">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">

                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-single-image sppb-text-center">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <div class="sppb-addon-single-image-container">
                      <img alt="Montfort Ngadda" class="sppb-img-responsive jch-lazyload" data-src="/images/jch-optimize/ng/images_2019_10_15_photo-monfort.webp" height="321" src="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHdpZHRoPSI0ODAiIGhlaWdodD0iMzIxIj48L3N2Zz4=" title="" width="480"/>
                      <noscript>
                       <img alt="Montfort Ngadda" class="sppb-img-responsive" height="321" src="/images/jch-optimize/ng/images_2019_10_15_photo-monfort.webp" title="" width="480"/>
                      </noscript>

                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="sppb-col-md-9" id="column-wrap-id-1571134868244">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1571134868244">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1571134868245">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block sections-txt3">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <h3>
                      MONFORT NGADA
                     </h3>
                     <p>
                      <em>
                       Class of 2016-2018
                      </em>
                      <br/>
                      <br/>
                      Coming from Cameroon, Monfort joined the master's program in 2016. He had already completed a Bachelor's degree in Sociology/ Anthropology at the University of Ngaoundéré and a Diploma in Design Engineering in Social Sciences for Development with a major in Population and Conflict Resolution at the University of Maroua in Cameroon.
                      <br/>
                      <br/>
                      With MITRA, he completed an internship with MISEREOR, a German NGO that implements and finances projects of national organizations or organizations working in Chad, as well as an internship at the Department of Immigration and Border Management (IBM) at the regional office of the International Organization for Migration (IOM) in Dakar during his mobility in Senegal.
                      <br/>
                      <br/>
                      « In terms of contribution, MITRA allowed me to do research and write a thesis on transnational migration between Senegal and France, which I believe are the mobilities that now characterize humans because of the ease of movement like never before. In addition to my stays at different universities/countries, I have obtained a triple master's degree, offering me a substantial advantage. »
                      <br/>
                      <br/>
                      His career has been marked by many associative experiences: he founded an association to involve young people and women in the management of a town in Germany, and was also a member of the Mitrajectoires student association, through which he participated in an
                      <a href="http://mitrajectoires.org/rapport-de-participation-a-la-formation-organisee-par-fundacja-po-drugie-en-pologne" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
                       anti-violence training in Suwalki in Poland
                      </a>
                      , as part of Erasmus+ with 7 other associations in Europe. Through his involvement with the Erasmus Mundus Association, he co-organised and led a
                      <a href="https://www.em-a.eu/de/home/newsdetail-ema-members-report/1st-information-event-promoting-erasmus-in-chad-2163.html" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
                       seminar with the EU Delegation in Chad
                      </a>
                      to promote Erasmus among Chadian students and teachers.
                      <br/>
                      <br/>
                      « All these skills and abilities later led me to a project management training course, after which I was recruited by the German GIZ Cooperation as a Young Professional/Internship. This allowed me to spend 6 months in Djibouti as part of the
                      <a href="https://www.giz.de/en/worldwide/40602.html">
                       Better Migration Management (BMM)
                      </a>
                      program that I just finished. »
                     </p>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>

    <div class="g-container">
     <div class="g-grid">
      <div class="g-block size-100">
       <div class="g-content">
        <div class="platform-content row-fluid">
         <div class="span12">
          <div class="sp-page-builder page-11" id="sp-page-builder">
           <div class="page-content">
            <section class="sppb-section margemoins1" id="section-id-1559659707673">
             <div class="sppb-row-overlay">
             </div>
             <div class="sppb-row-container">
              <div class="sppb-row">
               <div class="sppb-col-md-12" id="column-wrap-id-1559659707700">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1559659707700">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </section>
            <section class="sppb-section" id="section-id-1559654311481">
             <div class="sppb-row-container">
              <div class="sppb-row sppb-no-gutter">
               <div class="sppb-col-md-12" id="column-wrap-id-1559654311488">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1559654311488">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1559654311489">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block sections-txt">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <h1 style="text-align: center;">
                      Discovering research through research
                     </h1>
                     <p>
                      Partner institutions offer research-based learning content, supported by the teaching team’s individual and collective research projects.
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      The
                      <strong>
                       <a href="https://www.univ-lille.fr/home/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
                        University of Lille
                       </a>
                      </strong>
                      thus boasts two interdisciplinary research centres which offer academic expertise on questions studied in the programme classes:
                     </p>
                     <ul class="listeperso1">
                      <li>
                       The Research Group on Ethnic relations, migration, and equality (GERME).
                      </li>
                      <li>
                       The Centre on Migration, Asylum, and Multiculturalism (MAM).
                      </li>
                     </ul>
                     <p style="margin-top: 30px;">
                      Similarly,
                      <strong>
                       Babeș-Bolyai University
                      </strong>
                      contributes to research through two specialised centres:
                     </p>
                     <ul class="listeperso1" style="margin-bottom: 30px;">
                      <li>
                       The Institutul Pentru Studierea Problemelor Minoritatilor Nationale (ISPMN) studies national minorities, with a special focus on the status of the Roma community.
                      </li>
                      <li>
                       The Centrul de Studii Politice Si Relatii Internationale (CESPRI) is a centre of Political studies and international relations.
                      </li>
                     </ul>
                     <p>
                      The classes in European studies taught at
                      <strong>
                       Cluj
                      </strong>
                      ,
                      <strong>
                       Szeged
                      </strong>
                      and
                      <strong>
                       the University of the Aegean
                      </strong>
                      are based on collaborative research projects carried out through the Jean Monnet networks.
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      In
                      <strong>
                       Rio
                      </strong>
                      , students actively participate in the annual conference, the Forum on Migration.
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      In
                      <strong>
                       Dakar
                      </strong>
                      , the IRD committee supervises and organises research conducted on migration in West Africa and the less-studied internal migration in the region.
                     </p>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </section>
            <div class="sppb-section sppb-section-content-center" id="section-id-1559808572718">
             <div class="sppb-container-inner">
              <div class="sppb-row sppb-no-gutter sppb-align-center">
               <div class="sppb-col-md-6" id="column-wrap-id-1559808572742">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1559808572742">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1617194787471">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-single-image sppb-text-center">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <div class="sppb-addon-single-image-container">
                      <img alt="Image" class="sppb-img-responsive jch-lazyload" data-src="/images/jch-optimize/ng/images_2021_04_07_bande-barriere-fb-en.webp" height="1504" src="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHdpZHRoPSIyODgwIiBoZWlnaHQ9IjE1MDQiPjwvc3ZnPg==" title="" width="2880"/>
                      <noscript>
                       <img alt="Image" class="sppb-img-responsive" height="1504" src="/images/jch-optimize/ng/images_2021_04_07_bande-barriere-fb-en.webp" title="" width="2880"/>
                      </noscript>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="sppb-col-md-6" id="column-wrap-id-1559808572744">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1559808572744">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1559808572745">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block sections-txt3 dark animated fadeIn duration3 eds-on-scroll">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <span style="font-size: 18pt;">
                      <span style="font-size: 24pt;">
                       <strong>
                        MITRA Colloquium II
                       </strong>
                      </span>
                      <span style="text-decoration: none;">
                       <strong>
                        <span style="font-size: 24pt;">
                         Crossing perspectives on transnational migrations: an interdisciplinary approach
                        </span>
                        <br/>
                       </strong>
                      </span>
                     </span>
                     <span style="text-decoration: none;">
                      <span style="font-size: medium;">
                       <span style="font-weight: normal;">
                        <span style="font-size: 14pt;">
                         June 02 & 03, 2021, University of Lille
                        </span>
                        <br/>
                       </span>
                      </span>
                     </span>
                     <br/>
                     <span style="font-size: 12pt;">
                      The Master 2 MITRA students cohort 2019-2021 are organizing a colloquium of young researchers, in order to present the research work carried out in the framework of their end-of-year theses.
                     </span>
                     <br/>
                     <br/>
                     <span style="font-size: 12pt;">
                      More than that, it is also an invitation to young researchers (Master, PhD and post-doctoral level) from any discipline to join the program and communicate on their work, in French and in English.
                     </span>
                     <br/>
                     <br/>
                     <span style="font-size: 12pt;">
                      The call for papers is open until April 10, 2021.
                     </span>
                     <br/>
                     <br/>
                     <span style="font-size: 12pt;">
                      > Youth and migration
                     </span>
                     <br/>
                     <span style="font-size: 12pt;">
                      > Gender and sexuality in migration
                     </span>
                     <br/>
                     <span style="font-size: 12pt;">
                      > Identity, culture and diaspora
                     </span>
                     <br/>
                     <span style="font-size: 12pt;">
                      > Public action and migration
                     </span>
                     <br/>
                     <br/>
                     <span style="font-size: 12pt;">
                      <a href="https://nextcloud.univ-lille.fr/index.php/s/bQpKCHiGZkKmNyE">
                       Details of the call (FR)
                      </a>
                     </span>
                     <br/>
                     <span style="font-size: 12pt;">
                      <a href="https://nextcloud.univ-lille.fr/index.php/s/cqRa69dG3wZSi6Z">
                       Details of the call (EN)
                      </a>
                     </span>
                     <br/>
                     <br/>
                     <span style="font-size: 12pt;">
                      The conference will take place on Zoom and will be broadcasted live on several platforms.
                     </span>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>

                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1617194787459">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block sections-txt3 dark animated fadeIn duration3 eds-on-scroll">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <h2>
                      The first MITRA Conference
                     </h2>
                     <p>
                      The first MITRA conference was organised at the University of Lille on 24 May 2018. It dealt with various aspects of MITRA students’ research and field surveys.
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      Presenting their research in class
                      <strong>
                       offered students the opportunity to engage in debates over the challenges of migration studies
                      </strong>
                      .
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      French political scientist
                      <strong>
                       Catherine Wihtol de Wenden
                      </strong>
                      was the keynote speaker for this conference.
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      The themes covered were:
                     </p>
                     <ul class="listeperso2">
                      <li>
                       <strong>
                        migratory dynamics
                       </strong>
                       ,
                      </li>
                      <li>
                       <strong>
                        contemporary conflicts
                       </strong>
                       ,
                      </li>
                      <li>
                       <strong>
                        mobilising contemporary and multicultural civil societies
                       </strong>
                       ,
                      </li>
                      <li>
                       <strong>
                        constructing the othe
                       </strong>
                       r: stigmatisation and discrimination.
                      </li>
                     </ul>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1617194787460">
                   <div class="sppb-text-left">
                    <a class="sppb-btn sppb-btn-custom sppb-btn-rounded" href="/images/site-mitra/programme-colloque-mitra.pdf" id="btn-1617194787460" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
                     <i aria-hidden="true" class="fa fa-eye">
                     </i>
                     Download the academic calendar
                    </a>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
            <section class="sppb-section" id="section-id-1559825376608">
             <div class="sppb-row-container">
              <div class="sppb-row sppb-no-gutter">
               <div class="sppb-col-md-12" id="column-wrap-id-1559825376566">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1559825376566">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1559825376567">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block sections-txt">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <h2 style="text-align: center;">
                      Annual Conferences held in Cluj and Rio de Janeiro
                     </h2>
                     <p>
                      In the course of the programme, students will have the opportunity to attend and participate in annual conferences organised in Cluj and Rio de Janeiro.
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      Please find below the topics covered by previous conferences and workforce in recent years (presentations are available online:
                      <a href="https://forumdeimigracao.org/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
                       https://forumdeimigracao.org/
                      </a>
                      ) :
                     </p>
                     <h3 style="color: #544d9b;">
                      <span class="circlenumber">
                       1
                      </span>
                      Cluj :
                     </h3>
                     <ul class="listeperso1" style="margin-bottom: 30px;">
                      <li>
                       " Confronting perspectives on Africa: Democratisation, conflicts, intervention " (May 2015),
                      </li>
                      <li>
                       " Identity, Migration, and Conflicts " (May 2016),
                      </li>
                      <li>
                       " Literature and politics in Africa: a transdisciplinary approach " (April 2017).
                      </li>
                     </ul>
                     <h3 style="color: #544d9b;">
                      <span class="circlenumber">
                       2
                      </span>
                      Rio de Janeiro :
                     </h3>
                     <ul class="listeperso1" style="margin-bottom: 30px;">
                      <li>
                       annual forums: " a Forum on Migrations ",
                      </li>
                      <li>
                       annual symposiums: " A symposium on migration ".
                      </li>
                     </ul>
                     <p>
                      In
                      <strong>
                       Wroclaw
                      </strong>
                      , MITRA students also take part in an annual two-week seminar focussing on intercultural communication. They are joined by students from the Communication Department of Indiana University - Purdue University Indianapolis (The United States).
                     </p>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </section>

            <section class="sppb-section" id="section-id-1665563415987">
             <div class="sppb-row-container">
              <div class="sppb-row">
               <div class="sppb-col-md-12" id="column-wrap-id-1665563415986">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1665563415986">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1665563415990">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <div style="text-align: justify;">
                      <span style="font-size: 14pt;">
                       During the academic year 2021-2022, blank year for the new MITRA promotion, scientific activities were conducted, including webinars held from October 2021 to May 2022. These webinars have been recorded and are available on our
                       <a href="https://www.facebook.com/mastemitra/">
                        Facebook page
                       </a>
                       .
