            <section class="sppb-section" id="section-id-1665563415845">
             <div class="sppb-row-container">
              <div class="sppb-row">
               <div class="sppb-col-md-6" id="column-wrap-id-1665563415843">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1665563415843">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1665563415849">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-single-image sppb-text-left">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <div class="sppb-addon-single-image-container">
                      <img alt="Image" class="sppb-img-responsive jch-lazyload" data-src="/images/2022/10/12/logo-narrau.webp" height="320" src="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHdpZHRoPSIzMjAiIGhlaWdodD0iMzIwIj48L3N2Zz4=" title="" width="320"/>
                      <noscript>
                       <img alt="Image" class="sppb-img-responsive" height="320" src="/images/2022/10/12/logo-narrau.webp" title="" width="320"/>
                      </noscript>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="sppb-col-md-6" id="column-wrap-id-1665563415844">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1665563415844">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1665563415968">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <span style="font-size: 10pt;">
                      <strong>
                       25 OCTOBER 2021
                      </strong>
                     </span>
                     <br/>
                     <div style="text-align: justify;">
                      <span style="font-size: 10pt;">
                       NARRAU is a third sector research actor involved in territorialized research and societal innovation activities. Founded by Anaïs Trousselle and Itane Lacampre-Camus. Anaïs Trousselle, PhD in geography and agri-development engineer, spoke during this webinar.
                      </span>
                     </div>
                     <span style="font-size: 10pt;">
                      <a href="https://www.narrau.com/">
                       https://www.narrau.com/
                      </a>
                      <br/>
                     </span>
                     <div style="text-align: center;">
                      <span style="font-size: 12pt;">
                       <strong>
                        <br/>
                        NARRAU
                       </strong>
                       - Scientific research at the service of social issues
                      </span>
                     </div>
                     <div style="text-align: center;">
                      <span style="font-size: 12pt;">
                       "Introduction to migration dynamics - Issues and challenges in Europe"
                      </span>
                     </div>
                     <div style="text-align: justify;">
                      <span style="font-size: 10pt;">
                       <br/>
                       This webinar will focus on migration phenomena, which are constantly being reconstructed, and will look at Europe in the age of migration, as well as at the mechanisms put in place by the European Union.
                      </span>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </section>
            <section class="sppb-section" id="section-id-1665563415862">
             <div class="sppb-row-container">
              <div class="sppb-row">
               <div class="sppb-col-md-6" id="column-wrap-id-1665563415859">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1665563415859">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1665563415865">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-single-image sppb-text-left">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <div class="sppb-addon-single-image-container">
                      <img alt="Image" class="sppb-img-responsive jch-lazyload" data-src="/images/jch-optimize/ng/images_2019_10_30_csm__audrey__celestine__e43b9acd41.webp" height="300" src="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHdpZHRoPSIzMDAiIGhlaWdodD0iMzAwIj48L3N2Zz4=" title="" width="300"/>
                      <noscript>
                       <img alt="Image" class="sppb-img-responsive" height="300" src="/images/jch-optimize/ng/images_2019_10_30_csm__audrey__celestine__e43b9acd41.webp" title="" width="300"/>
                      </noscript>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="sppb-col-md-6" id="column-wrap-id-1665563415860">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1665563415860">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1665563415868">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <div style="text-align: justify;">
                      <span style="font-size: 10pt;">
                       <strong>
                        17 NOVEMBER 2021
                       </strong>
                      </span>
                     </div>
                     <div style="text-align: justify;">
                      <span style="font-size: 10pt;">
                       Audrey Célestine is a lecturer at the University of Lille, and co-director of the MITRA Master's degree. Her presentation is part of the MIGRINDOM research project, which focuses on migration in the French overseas territories.
                      </span>
                     </div>
                     <div style="text-align: justify;">
                      <span style="font-size: 10pt;">
                       Link to the project:https://migrindom.hypotheses.org/
                      </span>
                     </div>
                     <br/>
                     <div style="text-align: center;">
                      <span style="font-size: 12pt;">
                       <strong>
                        Audrey Célestine
                       </strong>
                       - Presentation of the MIGRINDOM project
                      </span>
                     </div>
                     <div style="text-align: center;">
                      <span style="font-size: 12pt;">
                       "Internal migrants. Governance and collective trajectories of migrants from the French overseas departments".
                       <br/>
                       <br/>
                      </span>
                     </div>
                     <div style="text-align: justify;">
                      <span style="font-size: 10pt;">
                       The objective of the seminar is to present research on migration in the French overseas territories. It will also focus on the post-colonial dimension of these migrations. One of the hypotheses of the project is that the organisation of migration in these territories has been a tool used by the public authorities.
                      </span>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </section>
            <section class="sppb-section" id="section-id-1665563415874">
             <div class="sppb-row-container">
              <div class="sppb-row">
               <div class="sppb-col-md-6" id="column-wrap-id-1665563415871">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1665563415871">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1665563415877">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-single-image sppb-text-left">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <div class="sppb-addon-single-image-container">
                      <img alt="Image" class="sppb-img-responsive jch-lazyload" data-src="/images/2022/10/12/university-of-szeged-squarelogo-1429695452966.png" height="180" src="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHdpZHRoPSIxODAiIGhlaWdodD0iMTgwIj48L3N2Zz4=" title="" width="180"/>
                      <noscript>
                       <img alt="Image" class="sppb-img-responsive" height="180" src="/images/2022/10/12/university-of-szeged-squarelogo-1429695452966.png" title="" width="180"/>
                      </noscript>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="sppb-col-md-6" id="column-wrap-id-1665563415872">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1665563415872">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1665563415880">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <div style="text-align: justify;">
                      <span style="font-size: 10pt;">
                       <strong>
                        2 DECEMBER 2021
                       </strong>
                      </span>
                     </div>
                     <div style="text-align: justify;">
                      <span style="font-size: 10pt;">
                       The University of Szeged is a member of the MITRA Consortium and offers students a course of study primarily in Law and European Studies.
                       <br/>
                       <br/>
                      </span>
                     </div>
                     <div style="text-align: center;">
                      <span style="font-size: 12pt;">
                       <strong>
                        Institute of International and Regional Studies - Faculty of Law and Political Science
                       </strong>
                      </span>
                     </div>
                     <div style="text-align: center;">
                      <span style="font-size: 12pt;">
                       "The Law of Foreigners, the Law of the Foreigner - Analysis of Legal Perspectives through Case Studies"
                       <br/>
                       <br/>
                      </span>
                     </div>
                     <div style="text-align: justify;">
                      <span style="font-size: 10pt;">
                       Through case studies presented by MITRA students, the aim is to analyse the perspectives of the development of the law on foreigners and the law of foreigners. The analysis is based on increasingly complex and sometimes contradictory legal frameworks. It also allows us to report on particular facts characterising, in a general way, contemporary migrations and sheds light on the public policies that seek to regulate them.
                      </span>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </section>
            <section class="sppb-section" id="section-id-1665563415883">
             <div class="sppb-row-container">
              <div class="sppb-row">
               <div class="sppb-col-md-6" id="column-wrap-id-1665563415881">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1665563415881">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1665563415886">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-single-image sppb-text-left">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <div class="sppb-addon-single-image-container">
                      <img alt="Image" class="sppb-img-responsive jch-lazyload" data-src="/images/2022/10/12/jiwnit-inline-logo-color_13x.png" height="101" src="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHdpZHRoPSIyMzgiIGhlaWdodD0iMTAxIj48L3N2Zz4=" title="" width="238"/>
                      <noscript>
                       <img alt="Image" class="sppb-img-responsive" height="101" src="/images/2022/10/12/jiwnit-inline-logo-color_13x.png" title="" width="238"/>
                      </noscript>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="sppb-col-md-6" id="column-wrap-id-1665563415882">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1665563415882">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1665563415889">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <span style="font-size: 10pt;">
                      <strong>
                       25 JANUARY 2022
                      </strong>
                     </span>
                     <br/>
                     <span style="font-size: 10pt;">
                      JiwNit is an association created in 2016 by Sahad Sarr, a Senegalese pan-African artist committed to the question of the place of youth in Senegal and to the decolonisation of Africa-Europe relations at the cultural, artistic and social levels, but also in the vision of Development.
                     </span>
                     <br/>
                     <div style="text-align: center;">
                      <span style="font-size: 12pt;">
                       <strong>
                        JIWNIT
                       </strong>
                      </span>
                     </div>
                     <div style="text-align: center;">
                      <span style="font-size: 12pt;">
                       "Appropriating tools for dialogue in intercultural contexts: the example of the Kamyaak eco-village project"
                      </span>
                     </div>
                     <br/>
                     <div style="text-align: justify;">
                      <span style="font-size: 10pt;">
                       The aim of this scientific event is to discover an example of a local development project in Senegal that deconstructs the Western model applied to local realities: the village of Kamyaak. This intervention also seeks to exchange on the very question of interculturality and the intercultural project, while decolonising knowledge.
                      </span>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </section>
            <section class="sppb-section" id="section-id-1665563415896">
             <div class="sppb-row-container">
              <div class="sppb-row">
               <div class="sppb-col-md-6" id="column-wrap-id-1665563415894">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1665563415894">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1665563415899">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-single-image sppb-text-left">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <div class="sppb-addon-single-image-container">
                      <img alt="Image" class="sppb-img-responsive jch-lazyload" data-src="/images/2022/10/12/1200px-universit_libre_de_bruxelles_logo.svg.png" height="1200" src="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHdpZHRoPSIxMjAwIiBoZWlnaHQ9IjEyMDAiPjwvc3ZnPg==" title="" width="1200"/>
                      <noscript>
                       <img alt="Image" class="sppb-img-responsive" height="1200" src="/images/2022/10/12/1200px-universit_libre_de_bruxelles_logo.svg.png" title="" width="1200"/>
                      </noscript>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="sppb-col-md-6" id="column-wrap-id-1665563415895">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1665563415895">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1665563415902">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <div style="text-align: justify;">
                      <span style="font-size: 10pt;">
                       <strong>
                        21 MARCH 2022
                       </strong>
                      </span>
                     </div>
                     <div style="text-align: justify;">
                      <span style="font-size: 10pt;">
                       The Université Libre de Bruxelles is one of the member universities of the MITRA consortium. Three researchers will participate in this webinar: Kostia Lennes (PhD student at ULB), Fiona-Katharina Seiger (post-doctoral fellow at the University of Rotterdam) and Pataya Ruenkaew (independent researcher).
                       <br/>
                       <br/>
                      </span>
                     </div>
                     <div style="text-align: center;">
                      <span style="font-size: 12pt;">
                       <strong>
                        ULB
                       </strong>
                      </span>
                     </div>
                     <div style="text-align: center;">
                      <span style="font-size: 12pt;">
                       "Migration research methods in the time of COVID-19 pandemic: challenges and strategies"
                       <br/>
                       <br/>
                      </span>
                     </div>
                     <div style="text-align: justify;">
                      <span style="font-size: 10pt;">
                       This scientific event focuses on research in the time of the Covid-19 pandemic. While traditional research methods are becoming difficult to implement in the face of various health restrictions, the aim is to analyse the strategies and methodologies put in place by different researchers.
                      </span>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </section>
            <section class="sppb-section" id="section-id-1665563415905">
             <div class="sppb-row-container">
              <div class="sppb-row">
               <div class="sppb-col-md-6" id="column-wrap-id-1665563415903">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1665563415903">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1665563415908">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-single-image sppb-text-left">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <div class="sppb-addon-single-image-container">
                      <img alt="Image" class="sppb-img-responsive jch-lazyload" data-src="/images/2022/10/12/logo-mawonsemfundobranco.png" height="406" src="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHdpZHRoPSIxOTQxIiBoZWlnaHQ9IjQwNiI+PC9zdmc+" title="" width="1941"/>
                      <noscript>
                       <img alt="Image" class="sppb-img-responsive" height="406" src="/images/2022/10/12/logo-mawonsemfundobranco.png" title="" width="1941"/>
                      </noscript>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="sppb-col-md-6" id="column-wrap-id-1665563415904">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1665563415904">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1665563415911">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <div style="text-align: justify;">
                      <span style="font-size: 10pt;">
                       <strong>
                        26 APRIL 2022
                       </strong>
                      </span>
                     </div>
                     <div style="text-align: justify;">
                      <span style="font-size: 10pt;">
                       MAWON is an association founded in 2009 by Mélanie Montinard (France) and Robert Montinard (Haiti), two years after their arrival in Brazil. The Franco-Haitian couple has a career in international cooperation between Haiti and Brazil and has extensive experience in the field of migration.
                      </span>
                     </div>
                     <div style="text-align: justify;">
                      <span style="font-size: 10pt;">
                       Link to the association:
                       <a href="https://www.mawon.com.br/">
                        https://www.mawon.com.br/
                       </a>
                       <br/>
                       <br/>
                      </span>
                     </div>
                     <div style="text-align: center;">
                      <span style="font-size: 12pt;">
                       <strong>
                        MAWON
                       </strong>
                      </span>
                     </div>
                     <div style="text-align: center;">
                      <span style="font-size: 12pt;">
                       "Role of CSOs in supporting the reception and integration of migrants in Rio de Janeiro"
                      </span>
                     </div>
                     <br/>
                     <div style="text-align: justify;">
                      <span style="font-size: 10pt;">
                       MAWON, was part of the actors of the associative world, interested in the migration experience. This webinar is an opportunity to discuss the relationship between migration, diasporas and associationism as well as the specific case of Haitians in Brazil. In addition, the role of NGOs and associations in the reception and integration of migrants in Brazil should also be analysed.
                      </span>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </section>
            <section class="sppb-section" id="section-id-1665563415914">
             <div class="sppb-row-container">
              <div class="sppb-row">
               <div class="sppb-col-md-6" id="column-wrap-id-1665563415912">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1665563415912">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1665563415917">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-single-image sppb-text-center">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <div class="sppb-addon-single-image-container">
                      <img alt="Image" class="sppb-img-responsive jch-lazyload" data-src="/images/2022/10/12/logo-university-of-wrocaw.jpg" height="110" src="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHdpZHRoPSI1MTAiIGhlaWdodD0iMTEwIj48L3N2Zz4=" title="" width="510"/>
                      <noscript>
                       <img alt="Image" class="sppb-img-responsive" height="110" src="/images/2022/10/12/logo-university-of-wrocaw.jpg" title="" width="510"/>
                      </noscript>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="sppb-col-md-6" id="column-wrap-id-1665563415913">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1665563415913">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1665563415920">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <div style="text-align: justify;">
                      <span style="font-size: 10pt;">
                       <strong>
                        25 and 26 MAY 2022
                       </strong>
                      </span>
                     </div>
                     <div style="text-align: justify;">
                      <span style="font-size: 10pt;">
                       The University of Worclaw is one of the member universities of the MITRA consortium and offers a semester focused on Cultural Sociology. For this conference, in cooperation with Purdue University (Indianapolis), the University proposes to discuss Culture and Communication.
                       <br/>
                       <br/>
                      </span>
                     </div>
                     <div style="text-align: center;">
                      <span style="font-size: 12pt;">
                       <strong>
                        University of Wroclaw (Institute of Sociology) and Indianapolis Purdue University (IUPUI)
                       </strong>
                      </span>
                     </div>
                     <div style="text-align: center;">
                      <span style="font-size: 12pt;">
                       "Communication and Culture"
                      </span>
                     </div>
                     <br/>
                     <div style="text-align: justify;">
                      <span style="font-size: 10pt;">
                       The 22nd annual two-day international conference on Culture and Communication. Topics include linking communication to politics, migration and migration integration policies, and film.
                      </span>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </section>
            <section class="sppb-section" id="section-id-1665563415923">
             <div class="sppb-row-container">
              <div class="sppb-row">
               <div class="sppb-col-md-6" id="column-wrap-id-1665563415921">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1665563415921">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1665563415926">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-single-image sppb-text-left">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <div class="sppb-addon-single-image-container">
                      <img alt="Image" class="sppb-img-responsive jch-lazyload" data-src="/images/2022/10/12/afis-coafro-final-fr-cu-qr-cestaf.png" height="4961" src="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHdpZHRoPSIzNTA4IiBoZWlnaHQ9IjQ5NjEiPjwvc3ZnPg==" title="" width="3508"/>
                      <noscript>
                       <img alt="Image" class="sppb-img-responsive" height="4961" src="/images/2022/10/12/afis-coafro-final-fr-cu-qr-cestaf.png" title="" width="3508"/>
                      </noscript>
                     </div>

                   </div>

                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="sppb-col-md-6" id="column-wrap-id-1665563415922">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1665563415922">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1665563415952">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <div style="text-align: justify;">
                      <span style="font-size: 10pt;">
                       <strong>
                        26 and 27 MAY 2022
                       </strong>
                      </span>
                     </div>
                     <div style="text-align: justify;">
                      <span style="font-size: 10pt;">
                       The COAFRO Congress is organised by several actors including the Babes-Bolyai University of Cluj-Napoca (Romania), one of the member universities of the MITRA consortium and which offers a semester of Comparative European Studies.
                       <br/>
                       <br/>
                      </span>
                     </div>
                     <div style="text-align: center;">
                      <span style="font-size: 12pt;">
                       <strong>
                        COAFRO
                       </strong>
                      </span>
                     </div>
                     <div style="text-align: center;">
                      <span style="font-size: 12pt;">
                       Interdisciplinary Congress on African Studies
                      </span>
                     </div>
                     <div style="text-align: justify;">
                      <span style="font-size: 10pt;">
                       <br/>
                       First edition of the Interdisciplinary Congress of African Studies, which aims to bring together specialists in African Studies to analyse the political transformations in Africa and the societal dynamics of the continent. The scientific event is interdisciplinary, and disciplines such as literature, sociology, history, international relations and political science are represented.
                      </span>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </section>
            <section class="sppb-section" id="section-id-1665563415955">
             <div class="sppb-row-container">
              <div class="sppb-row">
               <div class="sppb-col-md-6" id="column-wrap-id-1665563415953">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1665563415953">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1665563415958">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-single-image sppb-text-left">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <div class="sppb-addon-single-image-container">
                      <img alt="Image" class="sppb-img-responsive jch-lazyload" data-src="/images/2022/10/12/belmix-logo-300.png" height="300" src="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHdpZHRoPSIzMDAiIGhlaWdodD0iMzAwIj48L3N2Zz4=" title="" width="300"/>
                      <noscript>
                       <img alt="Image" class="sppb-img-responsive" height="300" src="/images/2022/10/12/belmix-logo-300.png" title="" width="300"/>
                      </noscript>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="sppb-col-md-6" id="column-wrap-id-1665563415954">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1665563415954">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1665563415961">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <div style="text-align: justify;">
                      <span style="font-size: 10pt;">
                       <strong>
                        31 MAY 2022
                       </strong>
                      </span>
                     </div>
                     <div style="text-align: justify;">
                      <span style="font-size: 10pt;">
                       The Workshop is organised by the BELMIX research team (FNRS PDR project), of which Asuncion Fresnoza-Flot, head of the MITRA Master's programme for the English-speaking section (ULB), is a member. Research website:
                       <a href="https://belmix.net/">
                        https://belmix.net/
                       </a>
                       <br/>
                       <br/>
                      </span>
                     </div>
                     <div style="text-align: center;">
                      <span style="font-size: 12pt;">
                       <strong>
                        BELMIX Workshop
                       </strong>
                      </span>
                     </div>
                     <div style="text-align: center;">
                      <span style="font-size: 12pt;">
                       "Situated mixedness: Understanding intimate diversity in contemporary Belgium
                       <br/>
                       <br/>
                      </span>
                     </div>
                     <div style="text-align: justify;">
                      <span style="font-size: 10pt;">
                       In recent years, Belgium has witnessed an increase in the phenomenon of mixed marriage, involving Belgian citizens and people from outside the European Union. In order to understand this phenomenon, it is necessary to situate it within broader social processes and multi-level contexts. This paper presents a number of case studies on marital mixing, some of which present the empirical results of an ongoing study on Belgian-Asian couples.
                      </span>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </section>

            <div class="sppb-section reverse centautoheigh" id="section-id-1557906451019">
             <div class="sppb-container-inner">
              <div class="sppb-row sppb-no-gutter">
               <div class="sppb-col-md-6" id="column-wrap-id-1557906451017">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1557906451017">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1557906451022">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block sections-txt animated fadeIn duration2 eds-on-scroll dark">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <h1>
                      Master MITRA,
                      <br>
                       <span class="smallest-block">
                        « Migrations transnationales »
                       </span>
                      </br>
                     </h1>
                     <p>
                      Le Master MITRA est un master bilingue (français et anglais) interdisciplinaire en sciences humaines et sociales, consacré à l'étude des phénomènes migratoires à l’échelle internationale et à leurs impacts sur les sociétés contemporaines.
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      MITRA forme des chercheurs spécialistes des phénomènes migratoires (poursuite d’études en doctorat), des analystes des politiques publiques en matière de migration et d'intégration (experts dans les organisations internationales ou territoriales) et des acteurs de terrain dans le milieu associatif.
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      Partie prenante de
                      <a href="http://www.isite-ulne.fr/index.php/fr/programme-gradue-cultures-societes-pratiques-en-mutation/">
                       l'un des programmes gradués internationaux
                      </a>
                      de l'Université de Lille, MITRA est à la fois un master professionnalisant et un master de formation à la recherche. Il est conçu selon une double logique : alternance des territoires d’étude en Europe et hors d’Europe, et alternance entre apprentissage académique et travail de terrain.
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      En fonction des parcours de formation, le
                      <a href="/apropos-mitra/consortium">
                       consortium
                      </a>
                      décerne aux étudiants un double ou triple diplôme de Master.
                      <br/>
                      <span style="font-size: 16pt;">
                       <br/>
                      </span>
                     </p>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="sppb-col-md-6" id="column-wrap-id-1557906451018">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1557906451018">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1558003954263">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-video">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-video-local-video-wrap">
                     <video class="sppb-addon-video-local-source" controls="" controlslist="nodownload" playsinline="" poster="/images/2019/05/16/poster-video-presentation-mitra.jpg">
                      <source src="/media/videos/2019/05/16/Master MITRA - présentation.mp4" type="video/mp4"/>
                     </video>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="sppb-section sppb-section-content-center" id="section-id-1558021948383">
             <div class="sppb-row-overlay">
             </div>
             <div class="sppb-container-inner">
              <div class="sppb-row sppb-no-gutter sppb-align-center">
               <div class="sppb-col-md-6" id="column-wrap-id-1558021948382">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1558021948382">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1558021948386">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block sections-txt dark animated fadeInRightBig duration2 eds-on-scroll">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <h2>
                      À qui s’adresse le Master ?
                     </h2>
                     <p>
                      Ce master s’adresse aux titulaires d’une Licence (180 ECTS) en sciences humaines et sociales, droit, langues, humanités, et par dérogation aux titulaires d’autres licences ayant une expérience professionnelle. MITRA offre une formation en français et anglais (niveau requis B2 du Cadre européen commun de référence) de 4 semestres. En fonction des spécialités de formation, le consortium décerne aux étudiants un double ou triple diplôme de Master.
                     </p>

                     <h1>
                      Mentions légales
                     </h1>
                     Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree (EMJMD) : MITRA - Migrations transnationales
                     <br/>
                     Directeur de la publication : Dori Marine
                     <br/>
                     Directeur de la rédaction : Leterme Chloé
                     <br/>
                     <h3>
                      Protection des informations nominatives
                     </h3>
                     Conformément à la loi n° 78-17 du 6 janvier 1978, relative à l'Informatique, aux fichiers et aux Libertés (articles 38, 39, 40), vous disposez d'un droit d'accès, de rectification et de suppression des données vous concernant, en ligne sur ce site. Pour exercer ce droit, vous pouvez contacter le coordinateur Master :
                     <br/>

                     Audrey CELESTINE et Nicolas MARTIN-BRETEAU
                     <br/>
                     Université de Lille
                     <br/>

                     <br/>
                     3 Rue du Barreau
                     <br/>
                     59650 Villeneuve-d'Ascq
                     <br/>
                     Téléphone : (+33) 3 20 41 60 60 10
                     <br/>
                     <br/>
                     L'utilisateur est informé que, conformément à l'article 32 de la loi informatique, fichiers et libertés du 6 janvier 1978 modifiée, les informations qu'il communique en raison des formulaires présents sur le site, sont nécessaires pour répondre à sa demande et sont destinées à l'éditeur du site, responsable du traitement, à des fins de gestion administrative.
                     <br/>
                     L'utilisateur est tenu de respecter les dispositions de la loi relative à l'informatique, aux fichiers et aux libertés, dont la violation est passible de sanctions pénales.
                     <br/>
                     <h3>
                      Conditions d'utilisation
                     </h3>
                     La responsabilité de l'EMJMD ne saurait en aucun cas être engagée quant au contenu des informations figurant sur ce site ou aux conséquences qui pourraient résulter de leur utilisation ou interprétation.
                     <br/>
                     - L'utilisateur du site reconnaît avoir pris connaissance des présentes conditions d'utilisation et s'engage à les respecter.
                     <br/>
                     - L'utilisateur reconnaît disposer de la compétence et des moyens nécessaires pour accéder et utiliser le site.
                     <br/>
                     - L'utilisateur du site reconnaît avoir vérifié que la configuration informatique utilisée ne contient aucun virus et qu'elle est en parfait état de fonctionnement.
                     <br/>
                     Les informations fournies par l'éditeur du site sont indicatives et ne peuvent dispenser l'utilisateur d'une analyse complémentaire et personnalisée. L'éditeur du site ne peut garantir l'exactitude, l'exhaustivité, l'actualité des informations diffusées sur le site.
                     <br/>
                     L'éditeur du site met tout en œuvre pour offrir aux utilisateurs des informations et/ou outils disponibles et vérifiés mais ne saurait être tenu responsable des erreurs, d'une absence de disponibilité des informations et/ou de la présence de virus sur le site. L'éditeur du site ne peut garantir l'exactitude, l'exhaustivité, l'actualité des informations diffusées sur le site.
                     <br/>
                     En conséquence, l'utilisateur reconnaît utiliser ces informations sous sa responsabilité exclusive.
                     <br/>
                     <h3>
                      Propriété intellectuelle
                     </h3>
                     Le site de l'EMJMD est une œuvre de création, propriété exclusive de l'Université de Lille protégée par la législation française et internationale sur le droit de la propriété intellectuelle. Aucune reproduction ou représentation ne peut être effectuée en violation des droits de la EMJMD résultant de la législation susmentionnée.

            <div class="sppb-section reverse centautoheigh" id="section-id-1557906451019">
             <div class="sppb-container-inner">
              <div class="sppb-row sppb-no-gutter">
               <div class="sppb-col-md-6" id="column-wrap-id-1557906451017">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1557906451017">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1557906451022">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block sections-txt animated fadeIn duration2 eds-on-scroll dark">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <h1>
                      MITRA,
                      <br>
                       <span class="smallest-block">
                        “Transnational Migrations”
                       </span>
                      </br>
                     </h1>
                     <p>
                      MITRA is a bilingual and interdisciplinary Master’s programme in the social sciences and humanities, taught in both French and English. It addresses international migration and how it impacts contemporary societies.
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      MITRA offers in-depth training to students aiming to specialise in migration studies and go on to doctoral degrees, public policy analysts working on migration and integration (including experts from international and local organisations), and intercultural mediators running community projects.
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      As a member of one of the University of Lille's
                      <a href="http://www.isite-ulne.fr/index.php/en/graduate-programme-changing-cultures-societies-practices/">
                       International Graduate Programmes
                      </a>
                      , MITRA prepares students for both further research and a professional career. This taught programme allows them to work on both European and non-European case studies, combining theoretical analysis with field surveys.
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      Depending on the students’ major, the
                      <a href="/about-mitra/consortium">
                       consortium
                      </a>
                      jointly awards two or three Master’s degrees on completion.
                      <br/>
                      <span style="font-size: 16pt;">
                       <br/>
                      </span>
                     </p>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>

                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <h2>
                      Entry requirements
                     </h2>
                     <p>
                      Applicants are expected to hold a degree in the social sciences, law, foreign languages, and humanities (180 ECTS). Exceptions can be made for students from other disciplines who already have some professional experience. MITRA is taught in both French and English, requiring B2 proficiency (CEFR). The duration of the programme is twenty-four months. Depending on the students’ major, the consortium jointly awards two or three Master’s degrees on completion.
                     </p>

            <div class="sppb-section reverse centautoheigh" id="section-id-1557906451019">
             <div class="sppb-container-inner">
              <div class="sppb-row sppb-no-gutter">
               <div class="sppb-col-md-6" id="column-wrap-id-1557906451017">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1557906451017">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1557906451022">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block sections-txt animated fadeIn duration2 eds-on-scroll dark">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <h1>
                      MITRA,
                      <br>
                       <span class="smallest-block">
                        “Transnational Migrations”
                       </span>
                      </br>
                     </h1>
                     <p>
                      MITRA is a bilingual and interdisciplinary Master’s programme in the social sciences and humanities, taught in both French and English. It addresses international migration and how it impacts contemporary societies.
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      MITRA offers in-depth training to students aiming to specialise in migration studies and go on to doctoral degrees, public policy analysts working on migration and integration (including experts from international and local organisations), and intercultural mediators running community projects.
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      As a member of one of the University of Lille's
                      <a href="http://www.isite-ulne.fr/index.php/en/graduate-programme-changing-cultures-societies-practices/">
                       International Graduate Programmes
                      </a>
                      , MITRA prepares students for both further research and a professional career. This taught programme allows them to work on both European and non-European case studies, combining theoretical analysis with field surveys.
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      Depending on the students’ major, the
                      <a href="/about-mitra/consortium">
                       consortium
                      </a>
                      jointly awards two or three Master’s degrees on completion.
                      <br/>
                      <span style="font-size: 16pt;">
                       <br/>
                      </span>
                     </p>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="sppb-col-md-6" id="column-wrap-id-1557906451018">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1557906451018">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1558003954263">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-video">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-video-local-video-wrap">
                     <video class="sppb-addon-video-local-source" controls="" controlslist="nodownload" playsinline="" poster="/images/2019/05/16/poster-video-presentation-mitra.jpg">
                      <source src="/media/videos/2019/05/16/Master MITRA - présentation.mp4" type="video/mp4"/>
                     </video>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="sppb-section sppb-section-content-center" id="section-id-1558021948383">
             <div class="sppb-row-overlay">
             </div>
             <div class="sppb-container-inner">
              <div class="sppb-row sppb-no-gutter sppb-align-center">
               <div class="sppb-col-md-6" id="column-wrap-id-1558021948382">
                <div class="sppb-column" id="column-id-1558021948382">
                 <div class="sppb-column-addons">
                  <div class="clearfix" id="sppb-addon-1558021948386">
                   <div class="sppb-addon sppb-addon-text-block sections-txt dark animated fadeInRightBig duration2 eds-on-scroll">
                    <div class="sppb-addon-content">
                     <h2>
                      Entry requirements
                     </h2>
                     <p>
                      Applicants are expected to hold a degree in the social sciences, law, foreign languages, and humanities (180 ECTS). Exceptions can be made for students from other disciplines who already have some professional experience. MITRA is taught in both French and English, requiring B2 proficiency (CEFR). The duration of the programme is twenty-four months. Depending on the students’ major, the consortium jointly awards two or three Master’s degrees on completion.
                     </p>
